# If adding new groups or ideas, make sure they are unique.



### Nation specific idea groups

#Empire of Anbennar ideas
Z01_ideas = {
	start = {
		morale_damage_received = -0.1
		liberty_desire_from_subject_development = -0.25
	}
	bonus = {
		governing_capacity_modifier = 0.15
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Z01 #Empire of Anbennar
	}
	free = yes

	Z01_the_mages_peace = {
		all_power_cost = -0.05
	}
	Z01_silver_and_steel = {
		discipline = 0.05
		diplomatic_reputation = 1
	}
	Z01_a_communion_of_peoples = {
		num_accepted_cultures = 4
	}
	Z01_children_of_the_dameshead = {
		trade_steering = 0.25
	}
	Z01_one_crown = {
		max_absolutism_effect = 0.15
		max_revolutionary_zeal = 15
	}
	Z01_flight_of_the_dove = {
		leader_naval_manuever = 1
		movement_speed = 0.15
	}
	Z01_an_eternal_dream = {
		possible_policy = 1
	}
}

#Eilisin ideas
A15_ideas = {
	start = {
		hostile_attrition = 1 # Fought Lorent alone for 13 years without surrendering, goes hand in hand with their first idea
		num_accepted_cultures = 1 # West Damerians are integrated
	}
	bonus = {
		max_absolutism = 10 # Witch King shit
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = A15
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	A15_13_years = { # Madalaire and Rubenaire eventually came round to Lorents side, Eilisin was the last one still fighting
		war_exhaustion = -0.03
	}
	A15_seizure_of_the_estates = { # Reanna seized the Nobles land after they rebelled.
		yearly_absolutism = 0.5
		global_autonomy = -0.05
	}
	A15_carnetori_restoration = { # We have a claim to the Kingdom of Carneter, however dubious we should press this claim
		fabricate_claims_cost = -0.25
	}
	A15_calas_last_crusade = { # Famous dude from the Greentide, he came home and aided in an invasion of Woodwell, where he was slain
		leader_land_shock = 1
	}
	A15_laurens_favoured_eilis = { # Of all the Wine Kids, Eilis was the kings favourite and misbehaviour was oft overlooked
		unjustified_demands = -0.2
	}
	A15_minaras_fist = { # They primarily worship Minara, unlike their Lorentish bretheren who mainly worship Adean. They see it as their duty to uphold Minar traditions
		land_morale = 0.1
	}
	A15_vineyards_of_life = { # Using necromany or other bad magic to grow more plants, make mention of some shady ruler in Eilisin during the later periods
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.1
	}
}

#Ordinger Ideas
A17_ideas = {
	start = {
		caravan_power = 0.2 # They're rural yo
		cavalry_power = 0.2 # Good at riding horses, same value as Lorent
	}
	bonus = {
		war_exhaustion = -0.02 # Advantage against exhaustion
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = A17
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	A17_maugan_the_unicorn_knight = { # Cool legendary knight dude who rode a Unicorn and fought the Sorcerer King
		leader_land_shock = 1
	}
	A17_ording_workhorse = { # Horse is from here
		build_cost = -0.1
	}
	A17_bound_to_our_word = { # Have a reputation as honest, straight talkers
		ae_impact = -0.10
	}
	A17_battle_of_clearshore = { # Ordingers fought off the Gerudian Invaders, pushing them out of Lencenor, while they would return later and found Deranne this was a major battle
		shock_damage = 0.15
	}
	A17_revive_entebenic_spirit = { # Everyone should be good at riding horses
		cavalry_cost = -0.20
	}
	A17_unify_the_flats = { # Denied our destiny after the Lilac wars (didn't get their cores) the time has come to take matters into our own hands and unify Low Lorentish
		province_warscore_cost = -0.15
	}
	A17_all_walks_of_life = { # Nobles and Commoners mix easier
		advisor_cost = -0.1
		advisor_pool = 1
	}
}

#Wex ideas
A30_ideas = {
	start = {
		global_manpower_modifier = 0.15	# A - unchanged
		ae_impact = -0.1			# A - less AE to somewhat counter wrong culture in EoA
	}
	bonus = {
		discipline = 0.05			# S - Wexonards are tough and militaristic
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = A30 #Wex
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	A30_lords_of_the_wexkeep = {		# C / C - Wex�s capital is the site of one of Balgar�s Wonders which they stormed and took during the days of the Dragonwake, and has remained their capital ever since. Owning one of Balgar�s Wonders gives them a bit of international recognition as a result.
		defensiveness = 0.10
		prestige = 1
	}
	A30_wex_must_rule = {			# C - Lothane III s�l Wex�s motto and probably one of the most memorable quotes. His mentality of �Wex Must Rule� by any means necessary leads to the Wexonards attempting to cajole and bully the Imperial Estates into line. In lore, it doesn�t work and falls to pieces when he dies, but what if the player can keep Lothane�s legacy alive, and the imperial crown in Wexkeep?
		imperial_authority = 0.1
	}
	A30_wexonard_school_of_fencing = {	# A - Greatswords, greatswords, greatswords. The Greatsword Companies are renowned for their strength and skill at arms, and also start including orcish and half-orcish mercenaries from Escann, from the mid 16th century onward for their strength and skill with the blade. Even some Wexonard knights use greatswords on horseback.
		infantry_power = 0.15
	}
	A30_court_of_the_grand_duke = {		# A - Wex�s the only Grand Duchy left in the EoA after Esmaria and Dameria collapsed, and serving at the Grand Duke�s court is thus a prized and notable position for any budding Wexonard philosopher, merchant patriarch or veteran soldier.
		same_culture_advisor_cost = -0.2
	}
	A30_forges_of_the_iron_hill = {		# A - Ironhill is one of the largest and most productive iron mines in the EoA - maybe even Cannor - and is the backbone of the Wexonard economy and war machine. Cheap and readily-available iron, combined with improved casting techniques in the mid 16th century, allows for easier mass production of cannons, armour and weapons.
		global_regiment_cost = -0.1
	}
	A30_the_burgeoning_burghers_of_wex = {	# B - With trade lanes to Verne via the Cotumer, the Salt Road to Arannen, and with Wex�s new conquests in the Damerian Dales sitting astride the roads from old Dameria to Esmaria and elsewhere, Wex is at the heart of Anbennarian trade with the east. Dostanor�s reclamation simply further adds to the importance of Wexonard influence on trade talks.
		global_trade_power = 0.1
		global_prov_trade_power_modifier = 0.1
	}
	A30_iron_within_iron_without = {		# S - The motto of House Robacard, lords of the Ironhill, and Grand Dukes of Wex following Camir Silmuna�s emperorship and removal of House s�l Wex in the 18th century. Wexonards� reputation as tough, grim, no-nonsense men of war means they can take a lot of punishment where others would falter in the face of incoming fire - but building a few defensive field fortifications never hurts either.
		fire_damage_received = -0.1
	}
}

		tag = A49
	}
	free = yes

		land_forcelimit_modifier = 0.15
	}
	A49_the_ivemkverag = { # mercenaries that became a proto nobility class for xanzerbexis, known as dyed thieves
		mercenary_manpower = 0.25
		mercenary_cost = -0.10
	}
	A49_wealth_of_the_wingwyrms = { # Gnolls found that damerian humans highly demanded wyvern toxin for alchemy, and developed new methods of hunting wyverns. Ended up being too effective and overhunted wyverns into near extinction
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	A49_brainmarrow_pact = { # To help in modernisation, the Queen of the Hill introduced a system in which mercenaries had to return to their home every few years and bring some kind of knowledge back with them as a form of tribute
		technology_cost = -0.05
	}
	A49_a_tack_in_businors_boot = { # having once been the terrors of businor, the gnolls know the lost hidden places and trails and partnered with human smugglers to make money
		leader_land_manuever = 1
	}
	A49_hillthrone_has_eyes = { # Queens of the Hill created an enforcer gang of young hostages from the disparate Khenak tribes
		global_autonomy = -0.05
	}
	A49_inquisitive_of_all_kults = { # Xhazobkult worship became more tolerable and more animistic, sacrificing animals and objects instead of humans
		tolerance_heathen = 2
	}

		prestige = 1
	}

	Z13_tribunal_of_free_men = { # After Redgar was slain by a relative of the man he murdered years ago, the freemen of the city, many of whom were reavers who fought with Redgar, gathered and discussed who would lead them, eventually leading to the creation of the Althing of Redgarhavn.
		republican_tradition = 0.3
		legitimacy = 1
		devotion = 1
		horde_unity = 1
	}

	Z13_the_expansion_of_thralldom = { # whereas some in Gerudia have cut down or even banned the practice of thralldom, Redgarhavn has expanded upon it to maximise its productivity, making thralls a pillar of the economy.
		production_efficiency  = 0.1
	}    

	Z13_merchants_and_reavers = { # Redgarhavn has found its success in Olavlund due to its talent of outcasts from across Gerudia, and their extensive knowledge of reaving being put to use as ruthless and cuthroat merchants.
		trade_efficiency = 0.1
	}

	Z13_alvorson_act = { #  Due to the sheer amount of thralls creating a massive risk of rebellion, certain rights and privileges have been given to them to keep them pacified without having to actually free them.
		global_unrest = -2.0
	}

	Z13_timmerman_lumber_company = { # The increased demand for timber to build ships has led to a prominent merchant forming a company to supply the shipyards with lumber.
		global_ship_cost = -0.1
		galley_power = 0.1
	}
    Z13_jormhjaert_naval_academy = { # The city stood as the last and most defiant port to stand against Gromber. As such, the Jormhjaert naval academy was built in 1700, and allowed the city could continue to battle grey fleets of Grombar until the magnate coup when it was occupied by Grombar.

		naval_morale = 0.10
	}

Z51_ideas = {
	start = {
		infantry_cost = -0.1 #Khozrugan has a large population of eager fighters.
		infantry_power = 0.15  #Expectations for strength and martial prowess are extremely high.
	}
	bonus = {
		 vassal_forcelimit_bonus = 1 #Khozrugan has begun to delegate land and powers to vassal clans at this point.
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Z51
	}
	free = yes

	Z51_urak_dul = {# It was strength that ended the Dwarves’ empire. It was strength that forged the Dookanson. And it was strength that shattered Escann. Now it is strength that will bring Escann under our domain.
		army_tradition_from_battle = 0.5
		unjustified_demands = -0.2
	}
	Z51_trample_the_corpse_of_wisdom = {# “Tradition is the corpse of wisdom” By the time Khozrugan formed, the orcs who ruled had little memory of the Serpentspine or even the initial Greentide invasion. The religious struggles and values of past generations were seen as little more than relics of an old age. Also didn’t care too much about Dookanism. 
		idea_cost = -0.15
	}
	Z51_cannors_tombstone = {# The sunken citadel of Bal Mire (“Ur Morduba” to the Orcs) became the capital of Khozrugan. While offense would still be favored over defense, the citadel and the surrounding swamp would play well into an active defense mentality.  
		 defensiveness = 0.15
	}
	Z51_osulband  = {# Even after 20 years, many orcs of the Greentide never recognized the value of the land itself. Khozrugan would not make this mistake. They would not strip the land, but rather ensure the weak stay tied to the land and provide for the strong.  (earthbind)
		supply_limit = 0.15
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	Z51_tazhor_u_bazu = {# Physical sports had always been a popular pastime for orcs. Orcs here adopt a more modern form of wrestling. 
		land_morale = 0.15
	}
	Z51_daroosh_bloodfist = {# Cool not orc dude was a serf on a farm. Overseer was a dick. Cool dude demanded combat. Overseer refused, but the cool dude didn’t back down. With a simple farming tool, he killed the overseer. Wasn’t punished, but instead was made the new overseer. 
		yearly_corruption = -0.05
		num_accepted_cultures = 1
	}
	Z51_the_overseers = {# as the clans fell away to overseers and their retinue and serfs, there came a rise to a new arrangement. They would rule in the stead of Khozrugan leader and in exchange, they would understand their place in the world.  
		liberty_desire_from_subject_development = -0.25
	}
}

#Estaire Ideas
B51_ideas = {
	start = {
		manpower_in_own_culture_provinces = 0.2
		diplomats = 2
	}
	bonus = {
		culture_conversion_cost = -0.2
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = B51
	}
	free = yes

	B51_the_chalice_woods = { # First king of Estaire was given a chalice by a dryad (Emerald Lady) in the woods. Chalice is magical and improves the King�s (and his close advisors�/knights�) health, and is a part of Estairey royal proceedings. Estaire as a whole worships nature goddesses and protects/spreads forests because of the dryad.
		legitimacy = 1
		monarch_lifespan = 0.15
	}
	
	B51_love_is_war = { # Estairey people are adventurous in love as well as in the field. Ladies often have suitors compete for their attention in balls, through feats of might and skill, while many lovers prefer to go for the challenge of wooing a more difficult (and usually married) target, leading to many scandals of cheating.
		heir_chance = 0.5
		nobles_loyalty_modifier = 0.1
	}
	
	B51_gallant_tolls = { # Estaire is a nation that has many forests, and unnaturally many dangerous magical beasts. In part because of that, the nation has many knights-errant who roam the countryside facing these creatures, and abusing their power to oppress the peasantry by collecting exorbitant rewards for small tasks. The elite Order of the Emerald Eye, personally anointed by the king with his chalice, are the greatest of these knights, defending the interests of the nation (and of the Dryad).
		cavalry_power = 0.2
	}
	
	B51_the_eternal_jousting_tournament = { # Estaire likes parties, more specifically displays of martial prowess such as tournaments and jousting. They know this is old fashioned, and see it as maintaining old traditions alive
		 prestige = 1
	}

	B51_raised_for_success = { # Estairey princes are encouraged to play in the woods, though alone, as many other children go missing in the forest. This is due to the dryad wanting to manipulate the princes early, and the disappearances are due to her toying/not respecting normal kids.
		leader_land_shock = 1
		monarch_diplomatic_power = 1
	}

	B51_tableside_manners = { # Estaire has many refined customs
		diplomatic_reputation = 1
		same_culture_advisor_cost = -0.1
	}

	B51_kindred_revolt = { # A seer predicted the Uanced revolt in Estaire, led by the king�s bastard/nephew. To try and avoid that, the king and the lord�s started to prohibit peasants from owning weapons and dangerous tools, which made them depend more on the roaming knights and be less able to sustain themselves.
		harsh_treatment_cost = -0.25
	}
}

G63_ideas = {
	start = {
		development_cost = -0.10 #New ideas always welcome
		ae_impact = -0.1 #We wish to consolidate the Mteibhar peoples.
	}
	
	bonus = {
		artillery_power = 0.1 #So much iron we make guns with
	}
	
	trigger = {
		tag = G63 #Example
	}
	free = yes
	
	G63_hopes_of_the_mteibhar = {
		defensiveness = 0.15 #The Mteibhar Valley has been the Mteibharans home forever. Our people have used this valley as a site to connect with the souls around us. Now, as we grow stronger, we must consolidate the far fringes of the valley, protecting them from harm.
	}
	
	G63_grand_confederation = { 
		reform_progress_growth = 0.15 #Our unique government system represents every Delath within our boundaries. We can thus efficiently account for everyone's needs, and adapt to new ideas easily.
	}

	G63_bending_the_world = {
		drill_gain_modifier = 0.5 #Earthbending is cool for magic stuff, but its principles also teach us about balance, sturdiness, and level-headedness.
	}
	
	G63_outsider_ideas = {

		idea_cost = -0.05
	}

		shock_damage = 0.1
	}

		army_tradition = 1
	}

		land_morale = 0.1
	}

		advisor_cost = -0.1
	}

		prestige = 1
	}

		infantry_power = 0.15
	}
}

#Karakhanbar
Z54_ideas = {
	start = {
		infantry_power = 0.1
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		global_manpower_modifier = 0.2
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = Z54
	}
	free = yes

	Z54_black_hearth = {			# Forged weapons and firearms helped Pure Orcs win war against Emerald Horde. Firearms are now considered "good weapons", striking enemies with divine fire
		fire_damage = 0.15
	}
	Z54_shamans_of_the_blackmoon_clan = {			# Shamans from Blackmoon Clan were main opposition to Emerald Orcs. They were the ones who created Black Hearth - giant magical bonfire, torches from which were able to dispel fey magic
		same_culture_advisor_cost = -0.15
	}
	Z54_anti_fey_politics = {		# Anti-fey politics - After War of the Black Trees orcs are not going to tolerate any fey in their home.
		harsh_treatment_cost = -0.2
	}
	Z54_reforge_deepwoods = {		# Reforge Deepwoods - After defeating fey and their pet emerald orcs, pure orcs started slowly cut down Deepwoods, building their cities from wood and stone there.
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
	Z54_forest_roads = {			# To enhance communications among settlements, orcs started building roads inside deepwoods
		movement_speed = 0.15
	}
	Z54_bron_the_bonfire = {			# Bron Blackmoon was hero of War of the Black Trees and he helped in establishing young Karakhanbar. His famous deeds will be always remembered
		free_adm_policy = 1
	}
	Z54_deepwoods_manufactories = {	# Deepwoods Factories - After victory in the War of the Black Trees, craftsmen became much more respected among the orcs (since only they were able to provide firearms for army) and they were not so reluctant to become peaceful craftsmen themselves.
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.1
	}
}

#Parusad Bhola
R49_ideas = {
	start = {
		merchants = 1
		diplomats = 1
	}
	bonus = {
		mil_tech_cost_modifier = -0.1
	}
	free = yes
	trigger = {
		tag = R49
	}

	R49_legacy_of_the_lotus_princesses = {
		diplomatic_upkeep = 1
		female_advisor_chance = 0.33
	}
	R49_sacred_buffalo_of_kranakol = { #Since ancient times, the long-horned water buffalo that congregate in great numbers on the banks of the Dhenbasa have been revered by the people of Parusad Bhola. The noble creatures are respected not only for their _____ and _____, but also for the great boon they bring to the agriculture of the region - cattle dung from kranakol is among the best fertilizers of crops and gardens known in rahen. They great herds that are tended in Kranakol along the Dhenbasa will continue to be a boon to our nation for as long as they graze contendedly under our watchful eye.
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	R49_magnificence_of_the_ruby_garden = { #Sitting at the heart of Parusad Bhola is the ruby garden, a horticultural paradise of tropical plants spilling out of lavish pools and marble planters inlaid with rubies. To this day the garden serves as a notable gathering place of diplomats and courtesans, with many important individuals meeting here to hash out deals and negotiate agreements.
		diplomatic_reputation = 1
	}
	R49_long_struggle_for_maharaaja = { #To the north of Parusad Bhola sits the rich plain of Maharaaja, long divided between our rival Senapti Endhuvi and ourselves. While the jealous Rasirhids of Endhuvi have spent their years plotting and waiting to seize the land for themselves, we have worked behind the scenes to ensure that the power balance does not shift against us. All the while, we have been training our soldiers in cavalry tactics that will be vital on the wide open plains of maharaaja - for when conflict with Endhuvi does come, we know we will meet them in the contested lands, and the charge of our elephants and swiftness of our horses shall sweep the river watchers away once and for all.
		cavalry_power = 0.15
	}
	R49_sardiphadin_mercantile_concordat = { #In order to provide a coordinated response to the power of Bhuvauri merchants, Parusad Bhola leveraged its preeminence in regional politics to create a mercantile league that could exclude Bhuvauri from completely dominating the markets of Lower Rahen.
		global_trade_power = 0.15
	}
	R49_summit_of_the_three_titans = { #The Ruby Gardens of Parusad Bhola hosted the conference between the three great powers of The Jadd Empire, Vanrahar, and Bhuvauri that met to coordinate a response to the Siege of Khiraspid by the Command. Here they planned to drive the Hobgoblin Legions away from the city and plotted how land would be divided when the Command were driven out. This legendary meeting was recorded by many peoples and great works of art were commissioned showing the children of Phoenix, Tiger, and Dragon meeting in peace - and enhanced our reputation as the principle meeting place of all powers seeking to settle diplomacy in Rahen.
		prestige = 1
	}
	R49_wisdom_of_weary_warriors = { #After the end of the Great Dhujati War, many of the veteran warriors who fought in the Siege of Khiraspid returned home to find their lands ruined and homes destroyed. Many of these skilled soldiers found a new home in the countryside of Parusad Bhola, where settlement was encouraged by a government already looking nervously at the ambitions of the Jaddari, Vanrahari, and Bhuvauri. Those warriors who settled near the Ruby City brought with them great knowledge of military affairs that would prove invaluable for Parusad Bhola in the difficult wars of the former allies and, later, the Deioderan that would come in the next century.
		army_tradition = 0.5
	}
}

		uppercastes_loyalty_modifier = 0.1
		global_unrest = -1
	}
	R50_long_waking_from_torpor = { #For centuries the harimari of the Acension Peninsula paid scarce attention to the outside world, instead focused on internal squabbles spent a lot of years in decadence, concerned only with hunting parties and territorial feuding, but the efforts of a new cadre of ministers under the young prince Adaraghir helped revitalize Rabaghekhur and turn its focus outwards from the jungles once again. With the prince's ascension in 1464, Rabaghekhur began to rouse itself from its long period of inactivity and assert itself on the stage of Raheni politics once again.
		monarch_admin_power = 1
	}
	R50_trade_league_of_sardika = { #In response to a uprising in Sardika against the oppressive Bhuvaurite governor of the city-state in 1485, the newly energized senaptiate came to the city's defense and expelled the occupying soldiers of Bhuvauri. The Senapti Adaraghir met with local city leaders, many of whom were fearful of reprisals from Srmaya, and agreed to establish a protectorate over the city if the councilors of Sardika would lend their wealth to strengthening Rabaghekhur. This mutual defense and support agreement was the basis of the Trade League of Sardika, the alliance of city states on the Raheni Coast that Rabaghekhur would come to dominate over the following 20 years, leveraging their influence and strength of arms to gradually fold ever more trading cities into a mutual assistance league that challenged Bhuvauri merchant dominance along the coast.
		spy_action_cost_modifier = -0.2
	}
	R50_teakwood_hulls = { #Of the many great trees of the jungle, teak is notable for its hardiness and buoyancy, and this strength was of great value to the many ships that Rabaghekhur began to craft as its outward stance shifted not north to Dhenijansar, but south - across the waves of the Gulf of Pearls, to the Raheni city states resting on the eastern coast of Sarhal.
		ship_durability = 0.05
	}
	R50_exile_kingdom_of_the_pearl_gulf = {

	start = {
		reduced_liberty_desire = 10
		global_heretic_missionary_strength = 0.02
	}
	bonus = {
		diplomatic_upkeep = 1
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = Z57 #Karashar
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	Z57_liberation_of_bulwar = {	# All humans of Bulwar should be united under our rule, so we could lead them to slavation.
		province_warscore_cost = -0.15
	}
	Z57_half_orc_outcasts = {	# Half-orcs are spawns of our sins. We must get rid of them to show purity of our thoughts
		diplomatic_reputation = 1
	}
	Z57_sunguardians = {	# Humans of Bulwar were mistreated for too long. Now we, orcs, spawns of the Darkness, must protect children of the Surael from threats of this world.
		land_morale = 0.15
	}
	Z57_sacred_wives = {					# Our Warchief marries Bulwari noblewomen, but not to satisfy his lust, but to support them with his wealth and strength.
		stability_cost_modifier = -0.15		# Women in their turn pray for Warchief's soul salvation after death.
	}
	Z57_promoted_festivals = {	# Festivals dedicated to Surael seem to be large part of Bulwari life. We should ensure proper organization of these festivals
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1
	}
	Z57_bulwari_sages = {	# Karashar became centre of worshipping Surael, and it attracted a lot of wise men and women, who are willing to offer their services to the Warchief.
		advisor_cost = -0.1
	}
	Z57_restore_surani_irrigation_systems = {	# Gnolls, Sun Elves and our recent invasion devastated the Suran Valley. However, with peace restores in Bulwar we can focus on developing it.
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
}

#Pearview
A65_ideas = {
	start = {
		global_own_trade_power = 0.1 #Form very tight-knit and self sufficient communities out of necessity due to the many countries who want to take advantage of them
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.1 #Halflings are good at farming pears or whatever, yes yes
	}
	bonus = {
		defensiveness = 0.2 #Moundforts and proximity to reavers/kobolds/Alenic raiders have led to development of a defensive doctrine
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = A65
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	A65_a_bluefoot_heart = {	#Life on the Gawed side of the small country is often harsher than on the Lorent side, and Pearviewers are hardier and stand resolute in the face of hardship.
		reinforce_cost_modifier = -0.10
		land_morale = 0.05
	}
	A65_mound_forts = {	#Fortified mounds/bunkers as an extension of traditional halfling housing. Initally built to divert Appletoner raids away from the most important granaries and homes, but have been expanded and improved to be useful against any attacks through the years.
		garrison_size = 0.15
		fort_maintenance_modifier = -0.10
	}
	A65_pearwood_pipers = { #Pearwood is historically used to make woodwinds and other instruments - trained bagpipes + drums halfling regiments often accompany hired mercenaries as signalling units
		mercenary_discipline = 0.05
	}
	A65_the_superior_pome = {	#'An apple a day keeps the doctor away... but to pears they can't compare!' - A weak attempt, of many, by the national pear growers association to erode their greatest rival's cultural hold as the more popular fruit. These propaganda attempts have made many take Pearviewers less seriously than even normal halflings.
		ae_impact = -0.1
	}
	A65_newcobble_pie_festival = { #Yearly tradition where communities send their best pie makers to compete - ties country and communities closer together
		stability_cost_modifier = -0.10
	}
	A65_wine_poached_pears = {	#1600s famous dish made from fruity wine, poached pears, and a variety of spices from Aelantir and Haless: every Pearviewer family is said to have their own recipe.
		prestige = 1
	}
	A65_pimleebezz_the_true = { #While most of the gnomes abandoned the rest of the small country during the Dragonwake and subsequent Alenic migrations, Pimleebezz (an inventor) remained with the halfing family he married into in Pearview. Led to close cooperation and ties between Pearview and remaining gnomes after everything stabilized.
		fire_damage = 0.1
	}
}

#Bim Lau ideas

		defensiveness = 0.2 #Bim Lau has centuries of experience building fortifications
		fort_maintenance_modifier = -0.1 #As well as maintaining them
	}

		global_unrest = -1 #Due to the structured nature of Bim Lau's society people are less likely to rise up
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Y51
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	Y51_spirit_guarded_forts = {	# The forts of Bim Lau are not only guarded by humans and harimari, but their rankes are supported with spiritual guardians that strengthen the kingdom's defenses
		garrison_size = 0.5
	}
	Y51_the_phtau_telereng = {	# Bim Lau stretches between two major rivers of Haless, the Kharunyana and the OTHERRIVER. It was during the 300s that the first tolling stations were placed on the road between them, the Phtau Telereng, but of course tolls would be lighter for those who traded where the kings wanted. In time there came to be many roads, but the trading tax and control remained named after the first road between the rivers
		trade_steering = 0.25
	}
	Y51_the_eternal_duty = {	# The people of Bim Lau know their obligation is to protect their land and their people from threats both physical and spiritual and this is not something they can be swayed from
		land_morale = 0.05
		recover_army_morale_speed = 0.10
	}
	Y51_wisdom_in_stone_and_plaster = { # The necropolis does not only function as drain on resources, it is also a source of knowledge for the people on many things, among them matters of governance.
		reform_progress_growth = 0.15
	}
	Y51_perpetual_construction = { # Construction is engrained into the fabric of the country, there is always some going on. And so the infrastructure to support it is highly advanced
		build_cost = -0.1
	}
	Y51_tai_mios = { # The people of Bim Lau have paid a tax to the government specifically for the construction of the great necropolis. It's named the Tai Mios, the King's Gold, for the ancient and recent royalty buried there
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1
	}
	Y51_legacy_of_natahas_of_the_rapid_claw = { # Natahas was the warlord that conquered Bim Lau after Jaher's fall. He brought along with him the administrative institutions of the old Raj
		free_adm_policy = 1
	}
}

		idea_cost = -0.1
	}
	Y58_sphangaokbrach_battery_tactics = { #One of the first ideas implemented from the academy, the Sphangaokbrach Cannon was developed to aid in battle. Alongside this, complementary tactics were developed and taught to use the cannon to its full potential.

	}
	Y58_the_steel_constitution = { #In order to centralise the state, and so that the Dekkhang could be better followed, the king would codify it, as well as appending it to give concessions to High Philosophy priests and the merchant classes.
		global_autonomy = -0.05
	}
}

#Shanyutian Ideas - eel field people - masters of manipulating the flow of water to prevent floods and irrigate fields, known for raising freshwater eels in massive ponds

	start = {
		manpower_recovery_speed = 0.1
		global_unrest = -2 #The landscape of Shanyutian, filled with picturesque flocks of waterfowl flying around, worn down mountains tiredly reaching for the skies, and tightly packed rice paddies irridescent in the sun and sparkling with the mottled coats of masses of eels, is said to be among the the prettiest places under heaven
	}
	bonus = {
		development_cost = -0.1 #Masters at shaping wetlands and rivers alike to their benefit
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Y44
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	Y44_mottled_fields_of_white_and_brown = { #The muddy rice paddies of Shanyutian teem with thousands of eels underneath the water and thousands of ducks and other waterfowl above
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.1
	}
	Y44_the_last_resort_of_shanyutian = { #Reference to breaking the dikes and flooding out Jaher in his first invasion of the Xianjie region
		hostile_attrition = 1
	}
	Y44_familial_bonds = { #The Shanyutian people form close-knit family groups and have close ties with neighbors as it requires close cooperation and a lot of labour to construct river modification projects
		global_own_trade_power = 0.1
	}
	Y44_to_catch_an_eel = {	#Eels of course are very slippery and hard to catch. Can possibly reference a general or specific ability or doctrine to navigate quickly and easily around the water laden homelands of the Shanyutian
		movement_speed = 0.075
		leader_land_manuever = 1
	}
	Y44_jianshan_temple_monks = {	#Loosely river-mountain temple - located at base of a waterfall complex or something, the monks there are famous for meditating for weeks and being so dedicated to spiritual matters that they neglect physical needs and die/mummify themselves - the ultimate sign of devotion
		devotion = 1
		legitimacy = 1
		republican_tradition = 0.30
		horde_unity = 1
	}
	Y44_the_tea_and_iron_trail = {
		caravan_power = 0.2 #Trade from upper Yanshen passes through the river valleys of RIVER to reach the Porcelain Cities - the very same rivers which Shanyutian have extensively dredged and modified
	}
	Y44_heliu_architects_of_xianjie = { #Shanyutian are masters at constructing dams, dikes, canals, ect ect to direct yearly floods to their rice paddies and eel ponds, and thus have an innate sense for construction/engineering
		build_time = -0.10
		build_cost = -0.10
	}

#Vul Tenvach
G79_ideas = {
    start = {
		naval_attrition = -0.1 # cape of thekvussam storms
		land_forcelimit_modifier = 0.15 # lots of levies from places like uyarbaid
    }
    bonus = {
		colonist_placement_chance = 0.05 # severed coast colony
    }
    trigger = {
		tag = G79
    }
    free = yes

    G79_masters_of_the_straight_road = { # The Straight Road is a trade route as well used as it is ancient. Running across southern Taychend in a near-straight line from Korrimadhala to Imarchend, the route has long been the south�s inland economic artery � though the Tenvacha portion of it was not always so integral. While the overland route, up the Vyech, to the Kalavend remained open, Vuls Tenvach was impoverished � but when the bandits of Sibisimra rose in the 400s, and cut that road off, the merchants of the south had to find a different route to the Kalavend � through the sea, via Vuls Tenvach. Vuls Tenvach took great advantage of this sudden change in the mercantile landscape. Building its strength over the 5th century, it carved a great empire across the entirety of the Straight Road during the 6th and 7th, breaking Sibisimra�s power in the process. Though their period of rule would come to an end when one of their generals, a certain Eletam the Gold, betrayed them and subsequently subjugated the city � forming the Dumrusvarn Dannuka � the Tenvacha remain proud of their history, and temples to the heroes that once mastered the Straight Road line the avenues of Vuls Tenvach.
		caravan_power = 0.2
    }
    G79_textiles_of_the_tapheta_toram = { # The southern regions of Vul Tenvach are famed around Taychend for producing the world�s most luxurious Tapheta cloth, a crisp cloth with a smooth feel, known for holding its shape extremely well. Before the founding of Ameion, this fame had driven many merchants and caravans to our cities for many centuries � with the opening of the Path of Wine going west to the Kheionai, Tenvacha ports become even busier as the westerners sought Taychendi produced textiles. Tapheta would also become one of most sought after goods in Taychend for the Cannorians, where womens fashion especially began to emphasise the stiffness Tapheta provides � the massive increase in Tapheta�s price that occurred when Ameion closed their ports would be one of the main causes of the later Cannorian intervention and subsequent imposition of the Deylokem system.
		global_prov_trade_power_modifier = 0.1
    }
    G79_the_kappadi_war = { # Invading Vuls Tenvach is more difficult than one would think. With the cities of the north protected by a river and strong fortifications, and the cities of the south overland by the rugged hills of Uyarbaid, one must embark on a costly campaign of over-river sieges, or march south along the coast via Nagar Vyechei. Though a treaty with Laskaris prevented its conquest for decades, when war did break out Ameion chose the latter route. However the southern campaign too had a problem � the storms of Cape Thekvussam are legendary, known for wrecking inexperienced captains trying to round the cape. Only the sailors of Vuls Tenvach able to navigate it without issue, and resupply the cities of the south coast, preventing their capture. Through precise planning and timing, the ruler of Vuls Tenvach, Alvardip Tailarudu, managed to lure the Ambhen navy into a sea storm off the cape, which obliterated most of their invading fleet, at minimal cost to his own � dooming Ameion�s campaign. The Kappadi War, or the War of the Navigators, would help preserve Tenvacha independence for another 60 years, and though he would die soon after Alvardip Tailarudu would become a widely worshipped god-hero.
		leader_naval_manuever = 1
    }
    G79_olorises_the_great = { # A controversial figure, Olorises Pulojith was a bastard prince born to Alvardip Tailarudu and an Ambhen concubine, who would rule Vuls Tenvach from the 1470s to the early 1500s. Owing to his heritage, Olorises believed that Vuls Tenvach must adapt the ways of the Kheionai to survive � seeing his siblings as foolish for their traditionalism, Olorises staged a coup to usurp the throne from his half-sister, and soon set himself to reforming his kingdom along Ambhen lines. On land, Olorises pioneered the Tenvacha Phalanx, relentlessly drilling his troops in the unwieldy but powerful formation. Despite his abrasive and stubborn personality alienating him from the ageing Emperor Erankar, his military reforms would prove their worth at the legendary Battle of Gena, where the Tenvacha pikemen would defeat Ameion�s own in a fair fight, driving them from the field in a stunning victory. Though a lack of Larankarha support meant Olorises was unable to decisively follow up on his successes, his many victories would earn Olorises the official designation by the Ambhen Synkletos as an �Enemy of Ameion� � a badge of honour for any Free Taychendi.
		mil_tech_cost_modifier = -0.05  	 
		shock_damage_received = -0.1
    }
    G79_deyodeikakaupos_and_the_bag_of_winds = { # As the Ambhen navy learnt from the lessons Alvardip taught it, and set its sights once more on gaining naval supremacy, Olorises Pulojith knew that he needed to find a new edge against Ameion � and in the Bag of Winds, he found it. Said to be powered by a captured air elemental, the legendary Bag of Winds could propel a single normal sized ship forwards at great speed � or, of course, propel a single colossal ship forwards when physics would otherwise prevent it. Looking to the massive galleys of the Alecandi Kheions for inspiration, over 5 years Olorises built the Deyod�ikakaupos, a warship so large it had 20 tiers of oars, required 8000 rowers to move, even alongside the Bag of Winds, and was said to have a complement of 5000 archers and 5000 marines. No matter the exact numbers, the ship guaranteed Vuls Tenvach�s safety at sea. After Olorises death and the fall of Vuls Tenvach, it would be seized by Ameion, serving as the flagship of their navy. Eventually, it would meet its end fighting a titanic battle against the Exemplar�s Diranhria, blown to pieces by its rival ship�s precursor weaponry � though not before its ram narrowly missed cleaving the Precursor warship in two.
		flagship_cost = -0.25
		heavy_ship_power = 0.1
    }
    G79_the_coast_divided = { # Though the reign of Olorises made Vuls Tenvach the third power in Taychend, independent from Larankar or Ameion, his success could not outlast his death. After the siege of Vuls Tenvach in the 1510s the Kingdom was first vassalised as an Ambhen protectorate, then, after a failed revolt in 1565, annexed. However, Vuls Tenvach � now Deg�thion � would not be so easily integrated into Amieon�s empire. As Olorises the Great had already spent considerable effort introducing Kheionai customs and administration into Tenvacha political life, there already existed a class of semi-Kheionised nobles and warlords, who clashed with the newly raised Kleyeren, on top of the many Thekvrystana who maintained their traditional ways. The addition of the Oren Nayiru and eventually Ravelianism divided the coast further. Nonetheless, the province�s governors would attempt to solve the issue, even sponsoring a Thekvrystana colonial expedition to the Severed Coast in order to deport some of their more discontentious Taychendi subjects.
		num_accepted_cultures = 2
		expel_minorities_cost = -0.1
    }
    G79_under_laskaris_united = { # As Ameion�s rule frayed at the seams in the late 18th century, and Taychendi radicals and Ravelian missionaries once more found their way into Deg�thion, the divided coast became ripe for revolution � and the spark that would finally blow up Ameion�s empire. Monarchist-Liberal Radicals, imprisoned by Ameion in the prison-isle of Baruanasi, joined with Thekvrystana colonists returning from the severed coast to overthrow Ambhen rule, starting the Deg�thion War in 1787. Kemnarius Laskaris, the latest in the line of distinguished generals belonging to the line of the Conqueror, was sent to crush them � but as he began making progress against the rebels, a series of misinterpreted messages would result in him betraying Ameion and declaring himself King of Deg�thion, leading the rebels and his own forces against those Ameion sent to stop him. Eventually converting to Ravelianism to secure Cannorian support, Kemnarius would unite the divided coast under his charismatic leadership, turning Deg�thion into the strongest of the states that seceded from Ameion in the late 1800s.
		legitimacy = 1
    }
}

#Nakar Mlerek
G68_ideas = {
	start = {
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1
		advisor_cost = -0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = G68
	}
	free = yes

	G68_the_eldest_brother = { #SHARED-ISH Nakar Mlerek is the remnant of the eldest brothers' faction in the breakup of Nanru Nakar caused by a sucession crisis. He was a skilled administrator, but unpopular and unskilled at military stuff. His younger brother, envious of the eldest brother attempted a coup using his support in the military, but it failed and the youngest only managed to take over Nakar Kilaiek.
		legitimacy = 1
		devotion = 1
		republican_tradition = 0.3
		horde_unity = 1
	}
	G68_entichend_army = { #Nanru Nakar is the most densely populated area of Taychend and the plains of entichend is the most dense of these, that lets Nakar Mlerek field vast armies.
		land_forcelimit_modifier = 0.10
	}
	G68_strict_enforcement_of_the_castes = { #The five castes are important to uphold the traditional order and stability in Nakar Mlerek, therefore they are strictly enforced.
		stability_cost_modifier = -0.1
	}
	G68_experience_from_the_larankarha_wars = { #SHARED-ISH Larankar attacked the Kalavendhi dhavamai 3 times. The first was an indecisive war between Larankar and the united Nanru Nakar. In the Second the Larankarha were beat back after a siege of Nanru Nakar and Royakottar and Orenkoraim intervening (refer to Larankars ideas). In that war the ruler died at the end and the succession crisis happened.. The third was a quick conquest of the exhausted Nanru-Nakari states and the Lower Kalavend (refer to Orenkoraims ideas). In Nakar Mlerek this experience showed them they needed more troops to avoid being outnumbered again.
		global_manpower_modifier = 0.10
	}
	G68_robes_for_kings = { #Nakar Mlerek is renowned for producing the finest fabrics in all of Taychend which are popular among the upper class (maybe restricted for certain castes?)
		prestige = 0.5
	}
	G68_memories_of_the_golden_age = { #Palace of the rulers Nanru Nakar was built when Nanru Nakar ruled most of the Kalavend and has artefacts from everywhere from Enlarmai to Cankamam. It serves as a physical memory of our past achievements.
		army_tradition_from_battle = 0.5
	}
	G68_sack_of_the_three_cities = { #SHARED-ish when the Larankarha fell the exemplars who had helped the rebellious dhavamai turned on them and sacked the Three cities (perhaps after some disagreement about how to divide the spoils from sacking Urvand and the taychendi not converting to the Sun Cult?), but they managed to rebuild after unifying against the threat. As the Sun Elf army was looting and torching Nanru Nakar three conquistador forces had specific tasks: one led by an elf named Pisandal in Nakar Kilaiek one led by an elf named Alvarion in Nakar Kriadvai and one led by Kortazel himself in Nakar Mlerek. Kortazel would attempt to sieze the palace and the dhavama of Nakar Mlerek (who had been one of the main organisers of the rebellion against Larankar) so that Kortazel could force him to let the elves rule Nanru Nakar. The dhavama got away and he assembled the armies of all of the three cities which just arrived from Urvand (as they had marched slower than the elves) and led them in chasing the scattered elves out of the city, quarter by quarter.
		land_morale = 0.10
	}
}

#Nakar Kriadvai

	}

		tag = G70
	}
	free = yes

	G70_the_middle_brother = { #SHARED-ISH Nakar Kriadvai is the remnant of the middle brothers' faction in the breakup of Nanru Nakar caused by a sucession crisis. He was a renowned spymaster and conspired with the scavengers guild to sieze Nakar Kriadvai when the civil war broke out between the Oldest and Youngest brothers.
		diplomats = 1
	}
	G70_buried_ruins = { #The very tops of once great towers dot the urban landscape of Nakar Kriadvai, these towers give scavengers acess to a mysterious buried city below Nanru Nakar (Aercel) Tunnels have been excavated which connect to cavelike great halls (actually warehouses), palaces (actually massive workshops) and houses trinkets and artefacts from this buried city sell for a lot on the surface.
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	G70_catacombs_tax = { #The remains of the dead in Nanru Nakar are buried in the ruins underneath Nakar Kriadvai. Most are buried like the french catacombs, but some richer families bury their dead in their own decorated alcoves in exchange for paying some money that goes to the upkeep of the catacombs as a whole
		global_tax_modifier = 0.2
	}
	G70_experience_from_the_larankarha_wars = { #SHARED-ISH Larankar attacked the Kalavendhi dhavamai 3 times. The first was an indecisive war between Larankar and the united Nanru Nakar. In the Second the Larankarha were beat back after a siege of Nanru Nakar and Royakottar and Orenkoraim intervening (refer to Larankars ideas). In that war the ruler died at the end and the succession crisis happened. The third was a quick conquest of the exhausted Nanru-Nakari states and the Lower Kalavend (refer to Orenkoraims ideas). In Nakar Kriadvai this experience showed them they need to further integrate the many adventurers who flock to the city into their armies
		mercenary_discipline = 0.05
	}
	G70_paladi_aidakal = { #The Paladi Aidakal (green cloths) was an organisation of spies established in after the breakup of Nanru Nakar, they spied on the other Nakars and (later) Larankar. They put small pieces of torn, green cloth on their clothes to show eachoher they were trustworthy.
		spy_offence = 0.15
	}
	G70_mysterious_tunnels_uncovered = { #Recently a tunnel was dug which encountered a mysterious set of tunnels which werent dug by any Nakari scavengers, after this the scavengers exploring the surrounding areas have begun disappearing, therefore the scavengers guild has begun bringing weapons down into the excavation sites. (this would hint at "cave crawler" degenerated elves which would be an enemy that need to be dealt with in a mission tree)
		merc_maintenance_modifier = -0.10
	}
	G70_sack_of_the_three_cities = { #SHARED-ish when the Larankarha fell the exemplars who had helped the rebellious dhavamai turned on them and sacked the Three cities (perhaps after some disagreement about how to divide the spoils from sacking Urvand and the taychendi not converting to the Sun Cult?), but they managed to rebuild after unifying against the threat. As the Sun Elf army was looting and torching Nanru Nakar three conquistador forces had specific tasks: one led by an elf named Pisandal in Nakar Kilaiek one led by an elf named Alvarion in Nakar Kriadvai and one led by Kortazel himself in Nakar Mlerek. Alvarion would sieze artefacts dug up from the buried city, they only got a few of them as many of them were evactuated to the catacombs when they heard the news of the Elves' attack.
		global_monthly_devastation = -0.02
	}
}

#Nakar Kilaiek
G69_ideas = {
	start = {
		infantry_cost = -0.2
		advisor_cost = -0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = G69
	}
	free = yes

	G69_the_little_brother = { #SHARED-ISH Nakar Kriadvai is the remnant of the little brothers' faction in the breakup of Nanru Nakar caused by a sucession crisis. He was a skilled military leader, but despised by the nobles and scavengers for his rigidness. He was envious of the eldest brothers throne and attempted a coup using his support in the military using the justification that Larankar was ready to invade again at any time and that they needed a leader with experience commanding armies. The coup attempt failed and he instead took over Nakar Kilaiek.
		infantry_power = 0.10
	}
	G69_honour_in_battle = { #While Nakar Mlerek controls the palace and therefore the artefacts of the old empire of nanru nakar, Nakar Kilaiek hold its legacy of gtreat victories honourable battle
		prestige_from_land = 1
	}
	G69_expeditions_across_tryuppatai = { #Small slave raiding expeditions into the Lai peninsula find their origin in Nakar Kilaiek. They cross the Veyii Sikarha over the Tryuppatai pass they mostly follow the coast and stay away from the jungle and of those who venture into the forest many do not return.
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	G69_experience_from_the_larankarha_wars = { #SHARED-ISH Larankar attacked the Kalavendhi dhavamai 3 times. The first was an indecisive war between Larankar and the united Nanru Nakar. In the Second the Larankarha were beat back after a siege of Nanru Nakar and Royakottar and Orenkoraim intervening (refer to Larankars ideas). In that war the ruler died at the end and the succession crisis happened. The third was a quick conquest of the exhausted Nanru-Nakari states and the Lower Kalavend (refer to Orenkoraims ideas). In Nakar Kilaiek this showed them that they need better leadership.
		army_tradition = 1
	}
	G69_legacy_of_liandarha = { #Liandarha Mudaliar (warrior queen girlboss) was the ancestor of the unbroken line of lords of Nanru Nakar, she came from the west with her host in times now forgotten and conquered the city. From who is unknown. (She would actually be the leader of a peasant (slave?) revolt against precursor nobles) (Focus in Nakar Mlerek would be on the unbroken line of legitimacy)
		leader_land_shock = 1
	}
	G69_the_first_cannons_in_taychend = { #The kilaieknem (easterners) brought weapons unlike any seen before to Taychend. The most impressive of these was the cannon
		artillery_cost = -0.10
	}
	G69_sack_of_the_three_cities = { #SHARED-ish when the Larankarha fell the exemplars who had helped the rebellious dhavamai turned on them and sacked the Three cities (perhaps after some disagreement about how to divide the spoils from sacking Urvand and the taychendi not converting to the Sun Cult?), but they managed to rebuild after unifying against the threat. As the Sun Elf army was looting and torching Nanru Nakar three conquistador forces had specific tasks: one led by an elf named Pisandal in Nakar Kilaiek one led by an elf named Alvarion in Nakar Kriadvai and one led by Kortazel himself in Nakar Mlerek. Pisandal siezed the slave markets and told the slaves there they could be free if they follow the Elves and convert to the Sun Cult. When the Elves retreated many of the freed slaves are left behind and captured, but the little they learned about the sun cult they kept. The worship of this new eastern Sun god, Jaher, spread among Taychendi slaves, and after Nakar Kilaiek's recapture, with the looming threat of a slave revolt, the Dhavana of Nakar Kilaiek canonized Jaher as one of the gods of the Taychend in a move to appease the city's slaves.
		war_exhaustion = -0.02
	}
}

		legitimacy = 0.5

		republican_tradition = 0.15
		horde_unity = 0.5
		global_missionary_strength = 0.01
	}
	G39_what_all_true_warriors_strive_for = {	#Barbarians can be made to fight for good
		mercenary_discipline = 0.025
		num_accepted_cultures = 1
	}
	G39_the_rivers_ecosystem = {	#River-priests claim Ynnics are part of the river's ecosystem, as such they must not advance too fast or they'll disrupt their relationship with it. However hydropower technology is cool
		state_maintenance_modifier = -0.25
	}
	G39_i_have_what_you_want = {	#Lots of people come to Adbrabohvi seeking what the Ynn has to offer
		global_trade_power = 0.15
	}
	G39_i_have_what_you_need = {	#Adbrabohvi has been sacked. Expect retribution
		warscore_cost_vs_other_religion = -0.15

	}

		monarch_military_power = 1 #Morvel rules like a Warrior-Empress, resurrecting the legacy of Calrodiy the Great
	}

		tag = U69
	}
	free = yes
	U69_beauty_of_the_precursors = {	#Beautiful by Cannorian elf standards, plus one of the nicest places to live in Aelantir
		diplomatic_reputation = 2
	}
	U69_kyrrachean_dynasties = {	#Sarda dynasties are likened to a bouquet of everlasting flowers, because of their wild hair colours and their ancient origins. Succession is based off who has the most authentic hair colour, adoption and matrilineal marriages are considered valid.
		heir_chance = 0.5
		prestige = 1
	}
	U69_seltac_waystations = {	#Waystations used to maintain communications across the Ynnic Empire after navigating the Ynn became unviable, originating from Sarda Treehouse Striders
		envoy_travel_time = -0.25
		reinforce_speed = 0.10
	}
	U69_battle_of_nizamsto = {	#Early battle against Cannorians where the Sarda got aided by rain making the Cannorians' guns useless
		fire_damage_received = -0.10
	}
	U69_a_cannorian_dell = {	#Sarda is the region of the Ynn most open to Cannorians
		num_accepted_cultures = 1
		mercenary_manpower = 0.25
	}
	U69_drop_by_drop = {	#Lessons about politics and diplomacy by dealing with feudal lords can also be applied for dealing with Cannorians
		reduced_liberty_desire = 10
		diplomatic_annexation_cost = -0.1
	}
	U69_an_offer_you_cant_refuse = {	#Sarda vassalizes the Inek and recognizes them as a kingdom in 1627 (thousand-year-anniversary of Gelinik's departure)
		trade_efficiency = 0.05
		accept_vassalization_reasons = 5
	}

#Bianfang ideas
Y09_ideas = { #An ambitious Yan warlord with years of experience fighting the Command, extending his reach down the Yanhe on the back of rigid and disciplined military might. Warlord state into Prussia of the East.
	start = {
		infantry_cost = -0.1
		infantry_power = 0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		discipline = 0.05
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Y09
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	Y09_junbiao_standards_law = { #The only way mere humans can overcome the strength of the savage races is with intense physical regimen and military discipline to match. The soldiers that pass our stringent standards of fitness and proficiency will earn an exemption from taxation and corvee labour - if love and duty to our glorious state cannot inspire them, perhaps a monetary incentive will.
		drill_gain_modifier = 0.5

	}
	Y09_stormcloud_of_the_west = { #To the squabbling Yan city states downstream, we are the stormcloud looming from the West - but we know the true threat. A great horde of subhuman monsters threatens to engulf us. Unlike the hated Sun Elves, we know these invaders from the mountains to be ravenous and unyielding. The only way to survive is for us to sweep over divided Yanshen and forge a singular state - rigid and powerful like the hobgolins who threaten us. Without unity, Yanshen will fall to outsiders once again.
		core_creation = -0.1
	}
	Y09_bianfang_corridor = { #Pincered between the Phokhao mountains and the Oni infested hills to the north, the upper reaches of the Yanhe form a natural corridor between Yanshen and the rest of Haless. Our experience in the logistics of organising an army lends itself naturally to trading caravans and convoys.
		caravan_power = 0.2
	}
	Y09_ruled_by_the_three_weapons = { #The renowned poet Li Bai once remarked that Xianjie was a land ruled not by states or governments, but by The Three Weapons - the jian, the bow, and the spear. Almost two centuries later, this adage still rings true. The lawless frontier of bandit kings and self-proclaimed heroes chafes and seethes under our righteous governance. Disloyalty cannot be tolerated. We shall instruct our soldiers to remind our seditious subjects of the Three Weapons.
		harsh_treatment_cost = -0.2
		war_exhaustion_cost = -0.25
	}
	Y09_huangpoa_academy_of_logistics_and_war_sciences = { #Founded in 1632, the Huangpoa Academy of Logistics and War Sciences is the greatest collection of military minds in all of Haless. Huangpoa exists to train the next generation of officers against all threats, foreign and near. With practically unlimited funding from the state treasury, Huangpoa Academy pays handsomely for strange technologies and military expertise from foreign lands - we cannot defeat what we do not understand.
		general_cost = -0.1
		mil_tech_cost_modifier = -0.05
	}
	Y09_jadeite_crossguards = { #Our Marshals are more than just leaders in war - they are administrators of newly conquered territories, arbitrators in civil disputes, and scholars who contribute to the growing collection of treatises in the libraries of the Huangpoa Academy. They are no ordinary men, and we shall honor their status with ceremonial jade crossguards for their swords. It is the ultimate symbol of status that no amount of money or heritage can buy.
		prestige_decay = -0.01
	}
	Y09_kowtow_decree = { #The Kowtow - a kneeling bow with the head pressed to the ground - is the ultimate expression of submission and reverence in Yanshen. Under the Kowtow Decree, our marshals and senior state officials may demand that their lessers demonstrate their subservience with a kowtow. A refusal is a crime of the highest order - death is the usual punishment, but some of the crueler officials have been known to break the legs of offenders and exile them as crippled beggars, so that they may spend the rest of their lives kowtowing to peasants and animals to atone for their dishonor.
		max_absolutism = 10
	}
}

#Anjiang ideas (Safe River)
Y04_ideas = { #The highest population city of Yanszin (the heart of the Yan). They produce much of the food within the League. At the same time they are the most religious. High Philosophy gained much of a foothold within this land and it is often a central point of discission within daily life and the old high god temples form a central place in society even moreso than in many other cities of Yanshen.
	start = {
		development_cost = -0.1
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		missionary_maintenance_cost = -0.2
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Y04
	}
	free = yes

	the_league_of_yanszin = { #The League of Yanszin is an organization of the five citystates at the heart of the region: Yanchung, Juishui, Zhinshi, Anjiang and Yingshi. Founded in 276 AA, they are bound together for defense against the surrounding warlords. Other Yansheni nations don?t greatly trust them, yet they always seem to manage to get great deals. They have always gotten themselves out of difficult situations, pulling strings behind the scenes to bring about peace with minimal losses or even gains. Most famously they would play a central role in the conspiracy that led to the murder of Jaher.
		spy_offence = 0.33
	}
	Y04_a_peek_into_the_future = { #Often as often rumoured, the Yanszin have seem to have a unique view of what the future holds, almost like the oracle at Tughayasa. Anjiang seems to be the source of this information. It is not entirely clear how, though, as they do not emplay any seers, but there is an uncommon amount of students in Tughayasa that were either born in, or spent a large portion of their life in Anjiang. Perhaps that gives some impression of how...
		all_power_cost = -0.025
		global_spy_defence = 0.15
	}
	Y04_friends_near_and_far = { #While the Yanszin are not often trusted, the people of Anjiang are often regarded as friendly by many of their neighbours. Whether those people are tricked into letting their guard down as some warn is not clear, but it is undoubtedly true that the Anjiang have many friends and allies all around.
		diplomatic_upkeep = 1
		improve_relation_modifier = 0.1
	}
	Y04_the_local_debating_club = { #There is an interesting anecdote from a Cannorian traveller who visited Yanshen in the 17th century. She describes how the Anjiang are very eagre to debate theology and philosophy. And not just the well-educated. She discovered that there seems to be a debating club in every district and town where the locals discuss various aspects of their religion over a cup of tea.
		tolerance_own = 2
	}
	Y04_a_compassionate_handshake = { #There isn't much a little good faith can't help. The support of a friend and ally can just give you the confidence you need to do what you have been afraid of. This is well known in Anjiang and they have put this knowledge to the test in politics. They are masters at inspiring confidence in those downtrodden and upset. It is sometimes said that they are behind the Sir rebellion and many other revolts.
		rebel_support_efficiency = 0.5
	}
	Y04_chow_mein = { #Anjiang is both the greatest farmlands of the Yanszin and the largest importer of foreign grain in Yanshen. Most of this grain supply goes to the production of noodles for their national dish: Chow Mein. This is what mothers, grandmothers and wives feed their family and they like to say that without this stir-fry dish, Anjiang would be much poorer. As it stands it has the highest population of any of the Yanszin.
		land_forcelimit_modifier = 0.2
	}
	Y04_wenhe_education = { #Many aspects of Anjiang society are controlled by a group known as the Wenhe, the gentle. This order of philosophers and monks was founded in the early years of harimar's occupation of Yanshen. While originally they had missions all over the region, by the 1400s AA they are limited to just Anjiang, where they oversee the education of the youth. However should an opportunity present itself they will spring back into action to continue their most ancient of works.
		global_missionary_strength = 0.02
	}
}

#Yanchung ideas (Middle Yan)
Y08_ideas = { #Brother city of Zhinshi, built between the lake of Da Hu an the river Yan. It is primarily known for its central position along the Yan in terms of both trade and culture. Because of this importance it is also often the leader of the league of Yanszin.
	start = {
		trade_efficiency = 0.1
		diplomats = 1
	}
	bonus = {
		merc_maintenance_modifier = -0.25
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Y08
	}
	free = yes

	the_league_of_yanszin = { #The League of Yanszin is an organization of the five citystates at the heart of the region: Yanchung, Juishui, Zhinshi, Anjiang and Yingshi. Founded in 276 AA, they are bound together for defense against the surrounding warlords. Other Yansheni nations don?t greatly trust them, yet they always seem to manage to get great deals. They have always gotten themselves out of difficult situations, pulling strings behind the scenes to bring about peace with minimal losses or even gains. Most famously they would play a central role in the conspiracy that led to the murder of Jaher.
		spy_offence = 0.33
	}
	Y08_the_river_fleet = { #One of the main features of Yanchung is its large riverport. This is both where they recieve rivergoing cargo and where house the river fleet that protects their trade interests along the Yan. This fleet does not merely guard against brigands, it also serves to ensure reduced tariffs that their neighbours may seek to unleash upon merchants bound for Yanchung.
		global_own_trade_power = 0.1
	}
	Y08_stories_of_men_and_demon = { #Many people visit Yanchung as they travel up and down the Yan river. And they bring their coin and stories with them. Playwrights and actors have gathered in the middle of this crossroads, to take advantage of this opportunity and so Yanchung has become the heart of Yansheni culture. Now, it isn't merely a hub for trade, but people come from all corners of Yanshen to witness famous plays and dances depicting the myths and history of their people.
		prestige = 1
		culture_conversion_cost = -0.1
	}
	Y08_the_fishermen_of_da_hu = { #Yanchung's positioning between the Yan river and the Da H? lake has left them uniquely reliant upon fishing. And such is clearly reflected in their cuisine. Their variety of sweetened, grilled or pickeled fish are known by all local girls and women, both low and highborn. The largest group of fishermen, those that fish the Da H?, also provide large stocks of pickeled fish for military supply.
		land_attrition = -0.1
	}
	Y08_zhudezhin = { #While all are equal within the Yanszin in principle. Yanszin has attained a primary position among its peers, partially due to its wealth in trade, and partially due to its cultural importance. It has been able to throw around its political weight to sway the other cities into following its advice. In this it is quite often challenged by the more populous Anjiang, who have always come second. And so Yanchung remains the Zhudezhin, the Lord of the Yanszin.
		diplomatic_reputation = 1
	}
	Y08_fraternal_learning = { #While independently ruled, Yanchung and Zhinshi have been brother cities for centuries, with noble families closely intertwined very close diplomatic ties. Of course there are mutual benefits. As one of the weaker members of the Yanszin, Zhinshi's interests are protected by Yanchung. In turn the Zhinshi send some of their best scholars to aid in the governance of Yanchung.
		advisor_cost = -0.1
	}
	Y08_secrets_of_the_trade = { #Merchants from Yanchung can be found all over Haless, conducting business and sniffing out new opportunities. They have at times been accused of being spies for their home city, but it is never quite clear wether their investigations are of a strictly personal, commercial nature, or whether they have a deeper political background.
		discovered_relations_impact = -0.2
		merchants = 1
	}
}

#Zhinshi ideas (Central City)
Y06_ideas = { #Brother city of Yanchung. While their sibling city was the heart of culture and trade, Zhinshi became home to many scholars instead. It built up a library rivalled by few others in Yanshen and this wealth of knowledge has supported its university for many years. Many of the Eunuchs ruling around Yanshen spent at least a few years in this city to learn their trade. Perhaps only Tianlou stands higher as a centre for the administrative elite.
	start = {
		advisor_pool = 1
		advisor_cost = -0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		possible_policy = 1
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Y06
	}
	free = yes

	the_league_of_yanszin = { #The League of Yanszin is an organization of the five citystates at the heart of the region: Yanchung, Juishui, Zhinshi, Anjiang and Yingshi. Founded in 276 AA, they are bound together for defense against the surrounding warlords. Other Yansheni nations don?t greatly trust them, yet they always seem to manage to get great deals. They have always gotten themselves out of difficult situations, pulling strings behind the scenes to bring about peace with minimal losses or even gains. Most famously they would play a central role in the conspiracy that led to the murder of Jaher.
		spy_offence = 0.33
	}
	Y06_the_zhinshi_college = { #Zhinshi is famous for its university. It produces the largest amount of scholars and wisemen of all of Yanshen. Many statesmen also gain their education here, including the eunuchs that serve in the courts of the region. Only Tianlou surpasses Zhinshi in direct connections amongst the eunuch ruling class. Considering all this it is not surprising that Zhinshi is also ruled by some of the brightest minds of all of Haless.
		candidate_random_bonus = 1
	}
	Y06_xuezhe_of_philosophy = { #One of the three major fields in which the Zhinshi college excells is philosophy. It is there that the Xu?zhe (scholars) of philosophy debated for many years and defined some of the major philosophical principles that would be taken by Harimar to form the very basis of High Philosophy that would spread across his empire. Their teachings and writings lay at the basis of many of the different schools, but they had the greatest influence on the school of the Starry Eye.
		idea_cost = -0.1
	}
	Y06_xuezhe_of_the_chemics = { #The second major field in which the Zhinshi college excells is chemistry. The Xu?zhe of this faculty have spent many years researching with different elements, making some discoveries that would not be known in Cannor for many decades yet, such as the discovery of hydrogen gas in 1699 AA during an attempt to improve the Feiten hot-air balloons. They do research in the fields of explosives, medicines, poisons and many others. As a result Zhinshi assassins, doctors and generals all have the newest and best to apply in their field, even if it is unreliable at times.
		fire_damage = 0.075
		siege_ability = 0.075
	}
	Y06_yingming_analyses = { #One of the reasons that the Zhinshi university is so succesful is their methodical approach to experimentation, along with a certain lack of moral boundaries. Anything goes, so long as it is in the name of advancing science. And of course it needs to be properly analysed. The standardised Yingming, meaning smart, method has been relied upon within the university and is applied not only to chemistry but also to cases of law, philosophy, construction and others.
		technology_cost = -0.05
		innovativeness_gain = 0.25
	}
	Y06_xuezhe_of_law = { #The third major field in which the Zhinshi college excells is law. Perhaps to be expected, given how many of the ruling class come to Zhinshi to learn their trade, it is here that many of the new policies are invented. It was a Zhinshi educated eunuch that created Bianfang's legal system. With all of this experience, the administrators of Zhinshi have created a system that is hugely complicated, but due to their great skill functions wonderfully.
		yearly_corruption = -0.1
	}
	Y06_fraternal_protection = { #While independently ruled, Yanchung and Zhinshi have been brother cities for centuries, with noble families closely intertwined very close diplomatic ties. Of course there are mutual benefits. As one of the weaker members of the Yanszin, Zhinshi's interests are protected by Yanchung. In turn the Zhinshi send some of their best scholars to aid in the governance of Yanchung.
		defensiveness = 0.1
	}
}

#Jiushui ideas (Old Water)
Y07_ideas = { #The oldest city of the Yanszin. After Harimar's conquest of the region many harimari settled in the city and the nearby estates, building up a martial base within the region. After Jaher conquered the region these harimari joined his guard and they played a key role in his assassination.

	}

		tag = Y07
	}

Most famously they would play a central role in the conspiracy that led to the murder of Jaher.
		spy_offence = 0.33
	}
	Y07_the_lanxin = { #Jiushui was for a long time one of the primary locations of settlement for harimari in Yanshen until other cities surpassed it in interest. Nontheless the harimari culture that emerged in Jiushui influenced many aspects of eastern harimari society. Nowadays the most prominent remnant of harimari rule in Jiushui is the Lanxin, the Blue Star, a military order made up of harimari who have learned to combine aspects of eastern martial arts with their own ferocious fighting style.
		infantry_power = 0.1
	}
	Y07_the_cheng_of_jiushui = { #The cheng, or citadel, of juishui is one of the oldest and most many-layered fortresses of Yanshen. It has stood for thousands of years. Supposedly its foundations rest upon the ruins of a high temple, but despite great effort no good evidence of such a claim as been found. But both Harimar and Jaher saw the strategic importance of the fort and reinforced it.
		defensiveness = 0.15
	}
	Y07_jahers_blood_well_spilled = { #They, more than any other of the Yanszin played a role in the assassination of Jaher, as his employment of the Lanxin allowed the assassins to come within striking distance of their target. And so the pivotal role that Jiushui played in the history and future of Yanshen cannot be denied.
		ae_impact = -0.1
	}
	Y07_the_eldest_yanszin_city = { #While all the Yanszin cities are old, Jiushui is without a doubt the oldest. Its foundation goes back to a time before the Nadimraj in Rahen and when the earliest stones were laid in Yanshen.
		prestige_decay = -0.01
	}
	Y07_bend_with_the_wind = { #All of the Yanszin know that the best way to survive is to know when to concede and know when to resist. Like a stalk of bamboo they bend until their energy is unleashed and they slap back. The Lanxin have adopted this in their martial training and it has become a staple of Jiushui combat.
		shock_damage_received = -0.1
	}
	Y07_guru_suhan={#Guru Suhan was an Eastern Harimari from the city of Guhe. At a young age, he travelled through Haless for spiritual reasons, meeting practitioners of the different schools of High Philosophy and seeking out their way of life. Beginning to meditate upon the different schools, on their strengths and flaws, he found much to admire but also saw the myopia that arose from focusing on a single aspect of mortal existence. He reached the conclusion that the path of the High Gods requires focus on all moral aspects instead of on the perfection of one, a belief that would give rise to Suhan's Praxis in the late fifteenth century. 
		global_missionary_strength = 0.02
	}
}

	}

		reduced_liberty_desire = 10
	}

But it left the Clan of the Divine Call uniquely capable of managing the local populace.
		num_accepted_cultures = 1
	}
	Y25_revitalized_harimari_traditions = { #A thousand years after the division of the Harimari Empire, the Clan of the Divine Call had lost most of their harimari traditions. So in 1131 AA YOUNGHARIMARINAME travelled to Rahen and would return five years later with the a rekindled understanding of their ancient traditions. These are the ones they would uphold until the final demise of the dynasty.
		army_tradition = 0.5
	}
	Y25_students_of_heavenly_temples = { #Like many other pious students of the High Philosophy, the philosophers and scholars of Jiaz?y? are interested in the great temples of the High Gods. However more than an interest in the evidence that the High Gods left behind, they are also interested in how the temples themselves work. Perhaps one day they may be able to solve the mystery of how Harimar the Great disappeared from the great temple in Tianlou. Until then they will continue to marvel at the greatness of the High Gods' engineering.
		tolerance_own = 2
	}
	Y25_jiazuhanshi = { #The Jiaz?h?nshi are the Clan's strong arm, an elite core of warriors made up of the strongest cubs and the most experienced fighters. The young ones are taken apart at a very young age and given rigorous physical training. They are the ones who form the bodyguard of the lord when he enters battle.
		infantry_shock = 0.15
	}
	Y25_propagandistic_infrastructure = { #In 1510 AA, INSERTNAMEHERE of the Divine Call, lord of Jiaz?y? instituted a huge quantity of construction projects in the newly reclaimed lands along the Yan and at the coast to emphasize the restoration of the ancient empire. Additionally he graced every town of moderate size with a new public center for cultural and religious gatherings. The largest was that of Xiangnu, which would featured a total of one hundred rooms of various sizes located around a central courtyard and garden.
		build_cost = -0.1
	}
