#Khabtei Teleni
Y55_ideas = {
	start = {
		defensiveness = 0.2 #The nation is home to massive 12-sided fortified cities dotted along the river that unified with the biggest fort along the river, Khabtei Teleni.
		reinforce_speed = 0.15 #Many of the gates defending the forts have secret tunnels built into them for reinforcements to easily go relieve allies during a siege
	}
	bonus = {
		state_governing_cost = -0.15 #The multiple walled cities in Khabtei Teleni are, for the most part, self-sufficient and have elected local leaders that help ease the administration in the capital.
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = Y55
	}

	free = yes

	Y55_walls_of_earth_and_metal = { #The forts used by the people of Khabtei Teleni were created with a combination of iron found in mines that are located around the nation and the natural materials like rocks and soil. With how easily these materials are found, the maintenance of these forts have always been very low.
		fort_maintenance_modifier = -0.2
	}
	Y55_a_leakeban_people = { #While many of the upper nobles and the capital of the country follows the High Philosophy faith, many of the peasants and lower citizens instead follow the Transmutative Path. The royalty, and later the elected nobles, never pushed High Philosophy on the peasants and instead preferred to have both religions coexist in one country. Over time the people of Khabtei Teleni were nicknamed the "leakeban people", meaning mixed people in regards to their faith.
		religious_unity = 0.25
	}

	Y55_the_hermit_civilization = { #The majority of citizens in Khabtei Teleni live their entire lives inside of the massive 12-sided forts that are dotted along the river, and inside these forts the people have developed large self sufficient cities. The people know that there is limited space in these fortresses, and use every single inch to its maximum potential.
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
	Y55_memories_of_the_aphich_war = { #the name of the civil war(meaning noble war) that raged in the nation for 20 years after the collapse of Jaher's empire, where the nobility was fed up with the weak king's inability to lead and sieged the capital for 2 decades. Finally, after one of the generals made a deal with the nobility, they entered the capital and imprisoned the royal family before setting up a republic where every term a qualified leader was elected to help the people, and this republic persists to this day.
		candidate_random_bonus = 1
		legitimacy = 0.5
		devotion = 0.5
		horde_unity = 0.5
		republican_tradition = 0.15
	}
	Y55_river_of_wailing_swans = { #The river that runs through Khabtei Teleni is home to a type of rare black swan who are known to have a cry that sounds similar to a person wailing, and they only are said to appear during times of prosperity. The Biengdi people believe these voices helps repel evil spirits and bring good fortune to those who hear it. Many nobles and rulers from around Haless come to the river during festivals dedicated to the swans just to hear them cry at least once in their lifetime.
		war_exhaustion_cost = -0.25
	}
	Y55_pact_of_the_bai_uttamsen = { #the bai uttamsen, (meaning the three generals), are the three major generals that are stationed on the three walls guarding the capital, who are said to be descended from the first three generals of the nation. From their private forts, they train the garrison forces to defend the capital from any outside force.
		free_leader_pool = 1
		army_tradition = 0.5
	}

	Y55_saamdach_system = { #Saamdach is a title that the capital uses for the city states throughout the nation that have contributed the most towards the country's prosperity. Every decade or so officials rank these city states' contributions and then distribute the title, along with increased benefits such as greater privileges to the nobles of the top cities. The capital reaps the benefits of more income coming their way while the squabbling cities attempt to outdo one another to gain the title.
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1
	}
}

	F33_relay_outposts = { #During unruly period between the Aakhetan wars and the coming of Jaher, Akalses' borders were continually to secure the borders a series of relay posts were scattered throughout the kingdom to allow for the quick transfer of messages and the request for troops where they were most needed. During Jaher's campaigns in the east this system was developed to also be expanded while in foreign territory
		reinforce_speed = 0.15
		envoy_travel_time = -0.1
	}

	}

		expand_administration_cost = -1
	}

		tag = F35
	}
	free = yes

	F35_the_paper_spear = { #Since the bygone era of god kings, Azkabar was always the spearhead of innovations regarding administration. From the use of clay tablets to record trade deals and food stocks to the founding of schools to train scribes from a young age, Azkabar was always a step further from its rivals. It's not a surprise that latter, the gnolls, the Castanites and even the sun elves copied the Azkabari administrative system when they conquered Bulwar.
		possible_adm_policy = 1
	}
	F35_the_seat_of_justice = { #This ancient order of learned mages codifies and protects the laws of Bulwar. This fairly democratic institution maintains legal consistency between the various Bulwari city states and ensures that all people are equal before the law no matter their station.
		stability_cost_modifier = -0.15
	}
	F35_keeping_up_appearances = { #The citizens of Azkabar attach great importance on following the law and always presenting the best version of themselves. This level of self discipline can be seen in all the strata of the population, from the care the craftsmen put in their work, to the efforts soldiers put in their training. The numerous customs and polite civilities tend to always be respected... at least in public.
		discipline = 0.05
	}
	F35_beneath_the_surface = { #Behind the fa?ade of its perfect society, Azkabar possess another, darker, face. At night, many frequents illegal establishments where they can evacuate the pressure of the Azkabari society by engaging in debauchery. Most of the time, these practices are limited to orgies, but some have indulged in more sinister practices.
		spy_offence = 0.3
	}
	F35_prisoners_of_azkabar = { #The infamous black prison was built in 1140 under the order of Jexis to contain all the mages in Bulwar that broke the law (in most cases just by being human). The jails are guarded by Allips, spectral creatures that are incorporeal remnant of dead persons that were driven to insanity. They were conjured by spellcasters to drive the prisoners to madness.
		global_autonomy = -0.1
	}
	F35_the_obsidian_walls = { #The twelves meters tall obsidian black walls surrounding the city give an sinister felling. They were built during the age of god kings but have strangely never deteriorated with time. The official reason is that it's thanks to a unique type of stone you can't find anymore in Bulwar. Others have a more... morbid... theory, about an ancient abjuration spell involving human sacrifices.
		defensiveness = 0.20
	}
	F35_the_cult_of_the_eclipse = { #The adepts of the cult of the eclipse were always a source of concern for the leaders of the Sun Cult, old and new. These heretics believe the Onslaught was a salvation, meant to purge the humans that fell into corruption. Not a lot is known about the followers of the Deep Ones, but it is said that they meet in secret every new moon in their headquarters in the outskirts of Azkabar to work on their goal of bringing back their masters to rid mankind of its sinners once again.
		tolerance_own = 2
	}
}

		global_unrest = -2
	}

		movement_speed = 0.15
	}

		religious_unity = 0.25
	}
	Y26_conqueror_spring = { #The most famous hotspring is called 'Conqueror Spring', named that after the foreign conquerors Harimar, Jaher, and Jaerel all soaked in this spring located at the highest point on the nation.
		prestige = 1
		monthly_splendor = 1
	}
	Y26_soaked_men_tell_no_lies = { #Many outside officials come to the springs to soak, and sometimes during their relaxed state they spill secret information that they don't believe would ever leak. Chenjinteng spies in these baths however, record this knowledge to be used to infiltrate enemy courts easier.
		spy_offence = 0.2
	}
	Y26_center_of_neutral_trade = { #Chenjinteng was where many nations come to make trade agreements or treaties, as it's in a central position that has also been considered neutral in almost every conflict in Yanshen. Because of this neutrality, traders of Chenjinteng have always been able to gain extra favorable bonuses with both parties and gain even more wealth
		global_trade_power = 0.1
	}
}

		tag = R61 #Pasiragha
	}

They?ll return from the Serpentspine with a feral Goblin that they?ve made into a pet or blindly step onto a trap in a dangerous ruin. The embarrassment which comes from the adventures these ?heroes? go on is more than enough for us to deal with, and so before anyone seeks to adventure for whatever reason, they must go through state sponsored training to conduct themselves maturely and to not stand in the fire.
		mercenary_discipline = 0.05
	}
	R61_sharupalas_palace = { #Unique palace developed around High Temple
		development_cost = -0.1
	}

		drill_gain_modifier = 0.5
        shock_damage_received = -0.1
	}

		leader_land_manuever = 1
		leader_cost = -0.15
	}
	R61_vamayurs_codex = { #king vamayur was made senapti as he ruled the lands that protected the raj from western threats, but his true talent was as a competent administrator. There is a book passed down from ruler to ruler detailing proper administrative technique
		monarch_admin_power = 1
	}
	R61_hall_of_endless_discussion = { #a place where scholars discuss and debate theology and philosophy day and night without end. Originally began with just high philosophy scholars but soon expanded to have scholars of all religions
		tolerance_heathen = 1
		idea_cost = -0.1
	}
	R61_praiseless_pasiragha_press = { #raheni political cartoons began in pasiragha once the printing press came, and has been a valued staple of raheni politics since. More often than not really insulting
		power_projection_from_insults = 1
	}

		max_absolutism = 20

		prestige = 1
	}

		all_power_cost = -0.05
	}

Despite the highest ranked one being lock behind a magical glass ceiling, anyone can rise up throught the government rank, regardless of blood or birthright (which is cool compared to other feudal kingdom)
		years_of_nationalism = -5
	}
	Z99_the_shadows_flux = { #Wars are the best time for the common folk to try and rise through the rank of the Black Demesne, causing a huge influx of new recruit in the army. This phenomenon that happen every time the BD declare war is known as "The Shadows Flux"

	}

		discipline = 0.05
		acolytes_influence_modifier = 0.1
	}

		governing_capacity_modifier = 0.1
		reduced_liberty_desire_on_same_continent = 15
	}

#Elizna Ideas:
U05_ideas = {
	start = {
		global_sailors_modifier = 0.15 #Elizna has a great interest in maintaining control over the Divenhal and a large amount of its elves are proficient in some form of sailorship as a result.
		tolerance_heathen = 2 #While The Sun Elves are the Chosen of Surael, Elizna recoginizes that the Khet are a force of their own and have tried to find a syncretism between the two religions.
	}
	bonus = {
		manpower_in_accepted_culture_provinces = 0.15
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = U05
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	U05_kheteratan_syncretism = { #Elizna has adopted a fusion of the Phoenix Empire's and Khetaratan administration. In addition, have started to find a syncretism between the Sun Cult and and Khetism. Both serve a single god, who fought against the darkness and protects their people. Both sacrificed themselves so that their people may prosper. Both have chosen, the Elves and the Khet, who must guide their people.
		adm_tech_cost_modifier = -0.05
		religious_unity = 0.15
	}
	U05_imperial_fleet = { #After the death of Jexis, the legionaires left in Cannor took the imperial fleet to bulwar, where they attended the Kalib Conference, dividing the Phoenix Empire Into various Akalates. All the Akalates were required to welcome any legionaire to settle in their lands, and many of the sailors and admirals chose to settle in Elizna, bringing along with them much of the Imperial Fleet. The Admirality still holds a great influence in Elizna as a result.
		naval_morale = 0.15
		flagship_cost = -0.25 #If the migrant ship ends up in Elizna
	}
	U05_supremacists_no_more = { #Vulzin the Red was the governor or Kheterata during the time of Jexis' death, and remained loyal to her. While He was loyal to Jexis, and her policy of elven supremacy, often even more than the other Akals, his daughter Zaleria instead radically changed her policy: She knew that to rule Kheterata, Elizna would have to adapt it?s doctrine to Kheteratan customs, mandating members of her court to wear Kheteratan clothing and adopt some of it's customs. While there was initial opposition, over time these customs were integrated into the Eliznan court, and from there have started to spread into the rest of Eliznan society. Her son Oloris has continued this policy, and as a result most of the supremacist Elves have left for Sareyand, where their ideals are received with more open ears.
		years_of_nationalism = -5
	}
	U05_zelarias_marines = { #While previously most campaigns in Kheterata were bogged down by the desert terrain that dominates much of the eastern side, Zelaria instead opted to create a strike force that could transport troops rapidly across the coast, allowing a secure line of supply and faster campaigns. The Zelarian Marines have become an elite force, trained to be skilled in boarding, coastal combat and naval sieges.
		allowed_marine_fraction = 0.25
		siege_blockade_progress = 1
	}
	U05_merchants_and_craftsmen = { #The middle class of Kheterata has always been neglected by it?s current and previous rulers, but Elizna sees potential in enriching the middle class as our main supporters in Kheteratan soil, and thus making them everloyal to us.
		trade_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	U05_eliznan_sunrise = { #Eliznan sunrise is a special tea found and grown in Elizna exlcusively
		prestige = 1
	}
	U05_jahers_claim = { #Jaher was made heir to Khetarata, but he died too soon. Elizna argues that his claim extended to all sun elves, not just Jaher, and as such they are rightful claimants to Kheterata.
		imperial_mandate = 0.025
		ae_impact = -0.1
	}
}

#Skewered Drake
H73_ideas = {
	start = {
		cavalry_cost = -0.20
		envoy_travel_time = -0.2 #drake messengers
	}
	bonus = {
		army_tradition = 1
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = H73
	}
	free = yes

	H73_drakons = { #Drakons
		cavalry_shock = 0.15 #Born from the howling pit within Gor Vazumbrog, the scar left behind by the Hunter of the Deeps awakening, come the great Drakons upon which we ride. These beasts who were the apex predator of the middle Serpentspine, pending our arrival, are vicious creatures, naturally built for battle. Their reddish-black scales are as durable as diamonds, their bodies long and slender to weave between stalagmites with ease. Their pitch-black talons are capable of rending muscle and bone alike, doubling as tools with which to latch onto and run along the walls of the tunnels. The only way to make them more dangerous was to put our orcs upon them. Saddled upon these drakes we put our finest warriors to ride into battle causing devastating damage. As the drake tears through lines the orc finishes those left in its carnage, directing it from above to its next target.
	}
	H73_visages_of_wrath = { #Visages of Wrath
		morale_damage = 0.1 #Of the many terrible sights one might encounter among the dark annals of the Serpentspine, few would dispute that a Drakon rider is among the most frightening. Covered in bioluminescent algae, menacing images of death and terror are sprawled across these mounts. In a flurry of colors and pictures, they dash by in the tunnels. Should you manage to avoid this blur of light, it was most likely at the whim of the orc above so that he may get the kill personally.
	}
	H73_climbing_claws = { #Climbing Claws
		siege_ability = 0.15 #Emulating the Drakons they ride, the Skewered Drake warriors have managed to fashion iron rakes that they can attach to their hands and latch onto walls with. Much like a Drakon can scale cliffs, now they can too. Climbing over walls, the Skewered Drake warriors are able to bypass defenses otherwise impenetrable.
	}
	H73_great_skewers = { #Great Skewers
		supply_limit_modifier = 0.25 #To cook a drake, one often skewers it and roasts its chunks over a fire, proving tremendously difficult do to their size and the strength of their muscles. To overcome this, Skewered Drake have become masters at sharpening and crafting massive skewers to cook them and other beasts they come across upon. In fact, many orcs of the clan now carry these skewers around with them at all times when out traversing the Serpentspine, in numbers they are able to make camp with them by repurposing these skewers as palisades wherever they go.
	}
	H73_tools_of_the_trade = { #Tools of the Trade
		development_cost = -0.1 #The toughness of a drake's scales can not be understated, it is no wonder then that they would make such excellent tools. A drake's diamond-hard scales can be fashioned into a multitude of things, such as armor, but most importantly into pickaxes, hammers, and shovels. These tools are capable of mining tough ores and rocks, and should these tools ever chip or break there will always be more scales in short time.
	}
	H73_fight_night = { #Fight Night
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1 #A regular sporting event held by the chieftains of the Skewered Drake, these so called 'Fight Nights' are where they pit two drakes up against each other in a battle to the death. To add to the fervor of the event, orcs are allowed to bet on the winner in the hopes of making quick coin. In the end, no matter who wins the fight or bets, the chieftain gets a cut of the pool and clan gets that much richer from it.
	}
	H73_first_and_finest = { #First and Finest
		stability_cost_modifier = -0.15 #Gorrath may be known as the Wrathful but he was not merely a brute, he was also tremendously clever. Utilizing the existing layout of the ruined hold to administrate efficiently and effectively. It is due to this that the Skewered Drake clan has managed to maintain stability for hundreds of years with relative ease whereas many of their brethren in the Serpentspine have failed.
		max_absolutism = 5
	}
}

#Avamezan
F75_ideas = {
	start = {
		mil_advisor_cost = -0.25
		diplomatic_reputation = 1
	}
	bonus = {
		diplomats = 1
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = F75 #Avamezan
	}
	free = yes

	F75_a_history_of_heroes = { #For the entire history of our nation, we have been defended by brave heroes and warriors who sacrificed themselves to preserve our independence. From conflict to conflict, from the age of God Kings to the conquests of Jaher, they are a long and storied tradition in Avamezan.\n\nFirst came Idad the Brawny, legends say his strength was such that he shifted the course of the river that now runs through our lands, and brought us prosperity. He was also a great commander who led our armies during the Warlord Era. Next came Udish szal-Sharad, a brilliant politician and commander who?s sharp intellect allowed us to break free from Akalesian rule. Then most recently, and most upsetting, came Seyma szal-Radin. A human mage of masterful skill, someone who could have heralded a new age of glory for Avamezan. However, she was slain by the Sun Elven armies of the Phoenix Empire. But she did not go down without a fight, her and the other human mages fought bravely against those who saw their practice of magic as dangerous. This fighting spirit has ever left us.
		general_cost = -0.15
	}
	F75_the_szal_dumakal = { #The Avamezan Ruby was once the greatest treasure of our land. Mined from the northern mountains, we were led to the ruby by a wandering Magi who said that while we possessed it, we would have glory. A truly massive gem, it was shaped by our finest lapidarists into the shape of a sun, owing its discovery to our god. It was the mark of our divine right to rule to the rest of the rulers of Bulwar, but alas it has since been lost.\n\nDuring Jaher?s conquests, the army of Avamezan met his forces. In the heat of combat, Jaher?s legionnaires made it to the royal tent, and the fight within resulted in the shattering of the ruby. Fragments still remain, but they are nothing compared to what it once was. However, we have not forgotten the times when the ruby was whole. Our times of prestige and glory.
		legitimacy = 1
		devotion = 1
		republican_tradition = 0.3
		horde_unity = 1
		monthly_splendor = 1
	}
	F75_the_definition_of_firepower = { #The arquebusiers of Avamezan have a unique weapon in their arsenal. Equipped with flammable dust loaded into the barrels of our guns, they cough out fire and smoke along with the ammunition. Mined in the mountains in the north of the country, a mineral is mixed with sand and burning coal coke to produce the flammable powder. Highly dangerous and explosive, we need to handle it with care before we can unleash itm however the risks are well worth it. Dubbed ?the spit of the sun? by our priests, there are few foes who can survive it.
		fire_damage = 0.1
	}
	F75_horn_of_hermeias = { #An ancient artifact from the era of God Kings, the Horn of Hermeias is a great golden horn, covered almost entirely in jewels. The God-King Hermeias was the most tenacious and resilient amongst his contemporaries, and possessed the ability to turn into a bull at will.\n\nRediscovered by the dwarven archeologist C?nrod az-Mag, it cost a hefty sum for us to get it from him, but it has proven its worth. When the horn is sounded in the heat of battle, our soldiers remember what they fight for, and surge forth to push back all invaders.
		reserves_organisation = 0.1
		leader_land_shock = 1
	}
	F75_golden_races = { #If there is one thing outsiders know our realm for, it is horse racing. Held every year in our capital, the Hurasu Lismu, the ?Golden Races? bring together breeders and racers from all across Bulwar to participate. But in addition to those who participate, the event also attracts gamblers of all stripes, trying their luck to win big. And if there?s anyone who benefits from that, it?s the banks and moneylenders of our realm. So as long as we continue to sponsor these races, tha banks will have our back in hard times.
		interest = -0.5
	}
	F75_the_qanun = { #When violence consumes Bulwar, as cities burn and armies clash, the one thing that can always unite us is music. And there is no serenade that the humans and elves of Bulwar like more than the singing strings of a qanun. A traditional instrument that is believed to have its roots in Avamezan. The instrument is played resting on either the musician's lap or a table in front of them, with the strings arrayed horizontally. It is then played with both hands, one for the higher register, and one for the lower. The sound produced is nearly ethereal in its beauty, and can cause any in the area to stop to hear the ghostly hum of the quanun.
		improve_relation_modifier = 0.20
	}
	F75_Ia_the_healer = { #In the year 1787, a unique individual arrived at the court of the Akal. Her name was Ia, a sun elf, and she called herself a healer. She had studied medicine her entire life, and as the world became consumed with mechanics and artificery, she studied natural healing and practical medicine. When she arrived at the court of the Akal, the royal consort was suffering from an unknown illness. Within two days, she had discovered that the illness came from a fungi growing at her weekend manor, and was able to derive a cure. Immediately after, she was hired as the physician extraordinaire for all Akals of Avamezan since.
		monarch_lifespan = 0.15
		manpower_recovery_speed = 0.1
	}
}

#Hasr
F45_ideas = {
	start = {
		missionaries = 1
		free_leader_pool = 1
	}
	bonus = {
		num_accepted_cultures = 1
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = F45 #Hasr
	}
	free = yes

	F45_nexus_of_jadd_magic = { #Under the New Sun Cult, only elves were allowed to practice magic, with humans capable of casting spells forced to emigrate elsewhere or face death if caught using the 'elven' magics. The gnolls of Zokka's pack were even worse - those even suspected to be capable of magic were taken away, assuredly to be sacrificed in fiendish rituals.\n\nThough Hasr was never the most strict about enforcing the elven mandate, all of it came to change once the Jadd liberated us from the gnolls. Finally, those humans with magical talent were able to practice their craft openly, and our humble lands quickly became a home for those with magical capabilities. Originally taught by converted elves, magical tutelage was soon formalized and mages trained within Hasr have been responsible for winning countless battles for the light of the Jadd.
		mages_loyalty_modifier = 0.1
	}
	F45_a_fateful_meeting = { #Hasr can pride itself on its fervent resistance to Zokka. No matter how many terror parties were sent, no matter how many were publicly sacrificed to pacify the rest, our citizens never gave up on the hope of the light gracing them once again. The leader of this resistance was an individual named Marodeen szal-Akur, known as the "Hasr Hawk", and he was - and still is - one of the most popular figures in the area. Upon hearing of Zokka's death, they mobilized the entire country for a rising against the gnolls and what seemed to be the invading elves.\n\nCalmer minds prevailed, and the Hasr Hawk was eventually coaxed into requesting an audience with Jaddar himself. He came away from this meeting a fervent follower of the Jadd, and the endorsement of the Hawk was enough to bring much of the country over to feel similarly. His legacy might be seen even today, for the Hasr are some of Surael's most unconditional followers.
		tolerance_own = 1
		monthly_fervor_increase = 1
	}
	F45_half_elf_haven = { #Much of Bulwar was, before the coming of the Jadd, fervently hostile towards half-elves. Believing them abominations born of miscegenation, many akalates put them to death for diluting the chosen people. Until the coming of Zokka, the lands of Hasr took a similar approach. This rule found itself unenforced under the chains of the Devourer-of-Suns, for the simple survival of any with elven blood was enough of an accomplishment to spill any of it, diluted or otherwise. Though born of necessity, this tolerance became deliberate under the Jadd, and the mingling of races seen as just another piece of the plan for them all.\n\nThis tolerance did not go unnoticed by the inhabitants of the akalates - an exodus to Hasr was far more appealing, and far easier, for any refugee half-elves than any other. The cultural and intellectual skillbase of these high-elves allowed Hasr to flourish. Even now, we are able to draw more advisors from those who others have shunned.
		advisor_pool = 2
	}
	F45_growth_of_lentils = { #There is little land in the world like the plains of Suran. It is said that these lands are so fertile that one could walk barefoot through the soil and need to pick the seeds off of their feet. The plants of Suran are happy to produce seeds, seemingly content with the knowledge that they have been blessed with the chance to grow there. The most plentiful of all are the lentils, the lifegiver of Hasr.\n\nFound all over the Surani plains, these lentils seem to grow in a thousand thousand different ways, and each one is a trade of its own to master. Farmers from the vicinity of Hasr are especially talented at manipulating these crops, and their experience at farming has led them to become desired all over the Jadd Empire for their ability to make any lentil plant blossom as if it was within Suran.
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	F45_penance_for_the_gnolls = { #If one were to ask what the most important principle of the Jadd was, it is in Hasr that all would answer without hesitation that it was tolerance - that all peoples shine the same under Surael's light. Of course, it is also that most in Hasr would agree that the road there is longer than most for the gnolls. It is said that Zokka Devourer-of-Darkness could not convince a regiment from Hasr to follow him until he had farmed lentils for over a year, and could coax their riches out of the soil as naturally as any farmer.\n\nThough many in the Empire would hesitate to use force to subjugate the wicked, the denizens of Hasr have no such qualms. Having learned from pacifying the gnolls, commanders from Hasr understand that the only way to make light is through fire.
		harsh_treatment_cost = -0.25
	}
	F45_spell_tablets = { #Though Hasr had little in the way of ambition for grand monuments, the Jadd Empire saw fit to prepare a great monument to Surael, and all his children - adopted or natural. It was to a small, unassuming shrine in Hasr proper that they sought to do so. While renovating the building to prepare for the new construction, a secret chamber was discovered under the floor. Exploration of this chamber discovered faded magical relics and, more importantly, a series of spell tablets. Divination-dated to shortly after Jaher's conquest of Far Bulwar, these spell tablets appeared to be the buried research of a figure whose name could not be found.\n\nRegardless of who they were, their genius was unprecedented - the spells within this shrine were all of destructive power, in ways never even considered otherwise. Though the enemy can try to prepare for a fireball, the full glory of the sun is withering no matter how much one tries to shade themselves; Indeed, few expect the very sun above to turn on them and them alone.
		shock_damage = 0.1
	}
	F45_camel_back_rangers = { #Though all beings capable of accepting it can be the children of Surael, the myriad beasts of the land of Bulwar simply cannot share the same blessing. It is their nature to prey upon the innocent, and this nature is one that cannot be overcome. This says nothing of the bandits, be they desperate Sun Elves or other highwaymen, quick to infest the lands of the Jadd Empire when her troops march to war. Though they are far from identical, both bandit and monster will disappear into the sands at the first sign of trouble, which while alleviating the problem never quite solves it.\n\nIt was for this that the Hasr rangers were trained, to prepare a permanent solution to the hindrance of commerce. Lamashtus, chimeras, sphinxes, bandits, all fell equally to the rifle. Trained to ride camels, these rangers were responsible for protecting caravans and pursuing any fleeing raiders through the desert. The lessons learned through their battles with beasts and men are invaluable to cavalry commanders.
		cavalry_flanking = 0.25
		leader_land_shock = 1
	}
}

radavezyr_ideas = { #idea set for the veykodans when they take over Arverynn
	start = {
		tolerance_heretic = 2 #indifferent to the ynnics worshipping their river and not interested in proselytizing their ethnic religion to them
		cavalry_power = 0.10 #they ride beasts
	}
	bonus = {
		global_manpower_modifier = 0.15 #local ynnic soldiers make up the infantry backbone of the army
	}

	trigger = {
		OR = {
			AND = {
				tag = U21
				has_global_flag = veykodan_palace_coup
			}
		}
	}
	free = yes

	veykoda_tattooed_warriors = { #veykodans utilize their runic magic and imbue their own skin with it to enhance their combat abilities
		shock_damage = 0.1
	}
	veykoda_beast_bonds = { #they ride massive beasts such as sabertooth tigers and rhinoceroses into battle, which they use runic magic to bond with
		cavalry_shock = 0.25
	}
	radavezyr_mantle_of_the_emperor = { #claiming the legacy of the Ynnic empire legitimises the Veykodans' aim to conquer the entirety of the Ynn
		province_warscore_cost = -0.15
	}
	radavezyr_legacy_of_artan_coup = { #Artan the founder overthrew the decadent Vyrekynn dynasty, but before that he served as a capable pomentere, where he learned how the Ynnics fight and how to counter them
		discipline = 0.05
	}
	radavezyr_a_new_homeland = { #being continuously forced out of their homeland by the cannorians, the old veykodans flock towards the new realm established by their brethren
		development_cost = -0.05
		culture_conversion_cost = -0.10
	}
	radavezyr_the_mutton_tax = { #the veykodan beast riders have replaced the ynnic knights, but their beasts are much higher maintenance. This is the reason they instituted a "mutton tax" on the peasants, which requires them to surrender a quarter of their livestock every year to feed the fearsome mounts.
		cavalry_cost = -0.1
	}
	veykoda_the_settled_soul = { #veykodan religious beliefs speak of a dual soul in every person, while the old veykodans prefer the savage side of their soul, the veykodans who forged their new state see the value of the settled soul
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.10
	}
}

veykoda_ideas = { #veykodan tag if released as a client state or some other way, the palace coup did not happen

		cavalry_power = 0.10 #they ride beasts
	}

		global_manpower_modifier = 0.15 #every man woman and child is taught to defend themselves in the case of raids or reprisals from the colonists
	}

	trigger = {
		OR = {
			AND = {
				tag = U21
				NOT = { has_global_flag = veykodan_palace_coup }
			}
		}
	}
	free = yes

	}

		cavalry_shock = 0.25
	}
	veykoda_sarda_influence = { #whether because they were set up as a state, or simply because of proximity, Sarda culture and ways of life have influenced the Veykodan tribes, many of which started to emulate Sarda nobility
		legitimacy = 1
		republican_tradition = 0.3
		devotion = 1
		horde_unity = 1
	}
	veykoda_legacy_of_artan_loyal = { #Artan the brave fought as a loyal warrior of the Veykodan Guard established in Arverynn and became its first captain, his legacy will always be remembered
		land_morale = 0.1
	}
	veykoda_the_eternal_battle = { #the Veykodan homeland is continuously encroached upon by hostile settlers seeking to take it for themselves, forcing the Veykodans into a brutal guerrilla war
		hostile_attrition = 1
		war_exhaustion = -0.02
	}
	veykoda_new_towns = { #Veykodan lifestyle is shifting from the traditional tribal life to a more settled life in towns and cities, which are now springing up across the land
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
	veykoda_the_settled_soul = { #veykodan religious beliefs speak of a dual soul in every person, while the old veykodans prefer the savage side of their soul, the veykodans who forged their new state see the value of the settled soul
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.10
	}

		prestige_decay = -0.005
	}

		cavalry_power = 0.10
	}

		stability_cost_modifier = -0.15
	}
	U22_rune_tattoo_armour = { # With guns being introduced to the battlefield, the heavy plate the Ynnic knights use becomes impractical and useless to stop a bullet. Our infantry uses perfected rune tattoo magic to protect themselves instead
		fire_damage_received = -0.1
	}
	U22_proliferation_of_rune_tattoos = { # The Veykodan custom of magical tattoos has spread even to the Ynnics. While not nearly as effective on them as on those who have Veykodan blood, it still helps enhance their abilities and lets them work more effectively
		production_efficiency = 0.10
		global_heretic_missionary_strength = 0.02
	}
	U22_balgarsmith_invitation = { # The runesmiths of Argezvale establish connections with the Veykodan Rune Scribes allowing them to exchange knowledge for the secrets of Dwarven architecture
		build_time = -0.15
	}
	U22_all_under_the_emperor = { #From the Broken Sea, to the Cliffs of Ruin, all bow to the rightful Emperor of the Ynn and its great valley, by right of conquest and of blood.
		max_absolutism = 10
		yearly_absolutism = 0.5
	}

#Count's League ideas
B55_ideas = {
	start = {
		defensiveness = 0.15
		colonists = 1
	}

		legitimacy = 1
		republican_tradition = 0.3
		devotion = 1
		horde_unity = 1
	}

		tag = B55
	}

	B55_an_otherworldly_deal = { # When the greentide came, the nobles of castellyr were in a dire situation. caught completely off guard, house after house fell. however dire times lead to dire measures. A deal was signed with the hags in oldhaven who would offered to hide the League's headquaters from the Orcish Invaders.
		hostile_attrition = 1
	}
	B55_a_league_of_nobles = { #Counts league was formed from the remnant nobility of castellyr to stave off the greentide. however, that everything is harmonious in the counts league. Now that the tide has been stopped, many noble are keen to leave Oldhaven and reclaim their lost lands in Escann and push back the Orcish occupiers.
		land_morale = 0.1
	}
	B55_friend_of_lothane = { #Gave shelter to Corin's circle and overthrow the old nobility of Count's League to give the adventurers aid against the Greentide
		improve_relation_modifier = 0.25
	}
	B55_the_house_of_blacktower = { #The house of Blacktower began with the legacy of Venac the Arrogant, an acolyte of Nichmer the sorcerer king; and slaughter of munas moonsinger. Now it's legacy will be that of Carleon Blacktower and Counts League, who redeemed the crimes of his predecessors.
		diplomatic_reputation = 1
	}
	B55_the_order_of_oldhaven = { #When the chivalric nobility of castellyr, renowned knights famed for their military prowess retreated to oldhaven, many of the old orders fell. Blacktower and the remaining lords however, created a new order based in oldhaven to help train the new generation of young knights and secure the traditions of chivalric escann.
		prestige_from_land = 1.0
	}
	B55_the_wardens_of_the_white_wall = { #The Wardens were an old society in charge of maintaining the White Walls, founded in 9th century by Castan Realmbuilder. Thanks to their expertise Counts League was able to repair and restore a section of the White Wall.
		fort_maintenance_modifier = -0.05
		garrison_size = 0.10
	}

		fabricate_claims_cost = -0.25
		unjustified_demands = -0.2
	}

#Zanlib Ideas
H38_ideas = {
	start = {
		rival_border_fort_maintenance = -0.25
		naval_morale = 0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		state_maintenance_modifier = -0.2
	}

		tag = H38
	}
	free = yes
	H38_the_new_bastion_of_surakel = { #As the Old Sun Cult Faith falls in Bulwar, we have created a new haven for ourselves in Aelantir, where we will perserve the Old Sun Cult Faith and its practices.
		tolerance_own = 2
		church_loyalty_modifier = 0.1
	}
	H38_nabar_szel_lib = { #Zanlib requires every able-bodied citizen to spend several years being trained and stationed as a soldier of the Zanlib Army, which keeps the population strong and our forts manned at all times. These soldiers defend the country with their lives on the line, to protect the last light of Surakel.
		infantry_power = 0.1
		manpower_in_true_faith_provinces = 0.1
	}
	H38_promotion_of_bulwari_culture = { #While the ruinborn and the new adventurers coming from Cannor aren't as harsh as our previous elven masters in the west, our country is still young and at risk to fall to foreign influences. By establishing edicts against the promotion of non-Bulwari culture inside Zanlib, we can continue to preserve our ancient way of life. Neither Cannorians nor ruinborn shall shake the foundation of our nation!
		culture_conversion_cost = -0.2
	}
	H38_mage_institutions_of_zankumar = { #Not only did human Bulwari mages flee to Zanlib, but they also brought along many ancient genie artifacts and treasures for us to examine and incorporate into our research. With these new tools at our disposal combined with new precursor artifacts discovered near ruin sites, Zanlib mages have earned their place as one of Aelantir's top researchers.
		technology_cost = -0.05
	}
	H38_akalgumar_council = { #Every leader of Zanlib is guided by a large council of educated Zanlib officials, who help with ruling Zanlib and even expand the administration that one sole king couldn't do alone.
		free_adm_policy = 1
	}
	H38_the_heart_of_the_river = { #The name of our country translates to 'River Heart', and the river along our country's territory provides rich soil to build upon and create large cities reminiscient to the Bulwar of old.
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
	H38_guiding_light_of_surakel = { #Zanlib, being one of the many nations situated at the Trollsbay, sought to improve their ships of old. With expert Zanlib craftsmen, we have dramatically improved the power of our heavy ships so that we can achieve dominance.
		heavy_ship_power = 0.1
	}
}

#Phangban ideas
Y50_ideas = {
	start = {
		build_cost = -0.1 #Constant maintenance of one of the oldest and biggest bridges in Haless, along with the lake town that surrounds the island
		development_cost = -0.10 #city state which is able to expand not just in land, but onto the river in which there has grown a second floating Phangban.
	}
	bonus = {
		innovativeness_gain = 0.33 #ideas deposited in the bridge temple are innovative
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = Y50
	}
	free = yes		#will be added at load.

	Y50_bridge_temple = { #Phangban sits upon one of the causeways in which the Kharunyana can be crossed without boats, and as such is the site of signficiant commerece and travel from each direction. At the center the Kharunyana's rushing rapids sits the island of Fenglan, home to a temple along with a set of two ancient bridges which connect one side of the Kharunyana to the other. True to their ascetic and spiritual nature, the monks of the High Temple enacts a simple toll of each who desires to cross the river. Each traveller is given a single piece of paper and requested to write, what they write does not matter so long as it is truthful. The thousand year-old tradition has led to perhaps one of the greatest collections of knowledge in all of Haless and is the sight of much scholarly debate between scientists and philosiphers.
		idea_cost = -0.1
	}
	Y50_a_tax_for_everything = { #As a result of one of the largest - though not always well-oiled, buearacrices in the known world, Phangban has a tax for everything. While some might feel this is oppresive and might hamper the economy and immigration, it also has the added benefit that so long as someone is willing to be taxed, they are welcome in Phangban. Each day, thousands trade and haggle in the city square with a reasonable portion of each transcation going to the royal coffers.
		global_tax_modifier = 0.10
	}
	Y50_diverse_contacts = { #Phangban is a cosmopolitan city and is home to a hundred peoples and a hundred gods. Due to it's indifference to culture and race, Phangban boasts the most diverse population in all of Haless. Harimari Philosophers, Dwarven craftsmen, and Elven descendants of the Phoenix legions, and kobolds kept for luck all live amongst each other in Phangban. This not only allows us to tax many different people, but also gives us contacts all across Haless we can use.
		global_foreign_trade_power = 0.1
	}
	Y50_independent_spirit = { #Phangban's political history is a long and complex one, its independence broken by years of vassalage under the Hamiraj and Bim Lau. But what has remained true throughout its history is that the rule of law in Phangban has always been decided within its own walls and by its own peoples. Much of this is due to the talented diplomats that serve as Phangban's ambassadors to the outside world who have insured its autonomy from oppression by foreign yoke.
		improve_relation_modifier = 0.1
		spy_offence = 0.1
	}
	Y50_bhuvauri_slave_soldiers = { #While we have always been in the sphere of influence of Bim Lau, be it as a vassal, part of their realm, or neighbours, we have finally managed to secure our independence on the battlefield thanks to the aid of Bhuvauri slave soldiers, and now use them for most of our military needs, saving cost on militias and town watches. (How can this ever go wrong?)
		mercenary_discipline = 0.05
	}
	Y50_mass_produced_porcelain = { #While the other porcelain may claim to have invented porcelain or make the highest quality, the quantity of porcelain produced in Phangban has no equals. Any merchant worth his salt knows that there is always porcelain to be found in the marketplaces of Phangban.
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.1
	}
	Y50_sack_of_phangban = { #During the Typhoon of broken vases in 1699, Lorent bribed our and other porcelain cities' slave soldiers to betray us and open our gates, leading to the great sack of Phangban, in which the city was entirely devastated, and the secret of porcelain was revealed to the Cannorians. Although Phangban would never recover to it's pre-sack population or wealth, its citizens learned to pull strings all over the continent for that their city needed leading to a great network of merchants to support the recovering city.
		merchants = 1
	}
}

#Sarilahvan

#Jade March
R81_ideas = {
	start = {
		reinforce_cost_modifier = -0.2 #The oppressive regimes and large quantities of resources allows the Jade March to cheaply reinforce their armies
		development_cost = -0.1
	}
	bonus = {
		manpower_recovery_speed = 0.2
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = R81
	}
	free = yes

	R81_nirokyu_zonan = { #The Mountain Tax is a tax that was instated by the Command, which required the Jade March to send large quantities of gold, copper, iron and serpentsbloom to their overlord to support their war effort. In order to meet their quotas the taskmasters of the Jade March got both harsher and more efficient at ensuring their teams' production.
		global_trade_goods_size_modifier = 0.1
	}
	R81_stewards_of_gronstunad = {
		build_cost = -0.05
		defensiveness = 0.1
	}
	R81_labyrinthine_plantations = {
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1
	}
	R81_old_traditions_and_new_philosophies = { #The Jade March was a mix of godlost and traditional goblin religion. This merged into a composite religion of sorts.
		tolerance_own = 1
		tolerance_heathen = 1
	}
	R81_lessons_of_the_wolf = {
		land_attrition = -0.15
	}
	R81_exaltations_through_production = { #As the March Goblins shifted from an economy of resource extraction to an economy of manufactoring they adopted the system of exaltations from their hobgoblin overlords, but instead of requiring military excellence to advance in social standing it is outstanding skill in crafts in quality and quantity of goods produced.
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	R81_funding_the_great_insubordination = {
		spy_offence = 0.1
		rebel_support_efficiency = 0.25
	}
}

		idea_cost = -0.1
	}

		mercenary_cost = -0.2
	}

		heir_chance = 0.25
		prestige = 0.5
	}
	A99_the_green_river = { # The Green River is Varaine's main natural feature, and besides it's beauty, the Sulfur that gives it it's notorious green colour is very useful for local industries
		production_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	A99_pluralism_and_syncretism = { # Located near various races, cultures and eventually various religions, Varaine became an extremelly tolerant nation
		tolerance_heretic = 2
	}
	A99_alchemical_exploration_corps = { # Once a group focused on exploring the world for potion ingredients, the Alchemical Exploration Corps became Varaine's main diplomatic institution
		artificers_loyalty_modifier = 0.1
		envoy_travel_time = -0.25
	}
	A99_fine_powder = { # Due to the presence of the resources and an alchemical community, Varaine was forefront in the spread and development of Gunpowder in Cannor
		fire_damage = 0.10
	}
}

	}

		tag = Z14
	}

	Z14_the_svartrsaer_veda = { #the blacksea hunt, an annual competition out of avnkaup where local craftsmen demonstrate the quality of their ships in a great kraken hunt, selling off the surviving ships to the highest bidders
		global_ship_trade_power = 0.15
	}
	Z14_frossvindsend = { #Frozen wind pass, known as Frossvindsend by the local is the treacherous pass just north of Nyrford, yet the only way to cross the Titan's Grave Mountains for miles and miles. Even so, the call of adventure, and of the mythical golden forest, lure many an Avnkaupian across this way. Though many are doomed to die, frozen in time upon the pass' slopes, few make it across and find a supposed land of bounty and beauty.
		colonists = 1
	}
	Z14_clan_orstengard = { #In a land of war and bloodshed, many forget there is as much feasting and celebration. One such occasion was the union of Clan Fjordsson and Clan Orstengard, a feast that lasted for two weeks. Upon its conclusion, Orstengard became part of Avnkaup and has remained under our care since
		diplomatic_upkeep = 1
	}
	Z14_the_saga_guild = { #Saga was both legendary troll hunter and chieftess of Avnkaup in 1022. She and her wife co-founded the Saga guild, an organization of troll hunters. Though their HQ has remained in Avnkaup, many have moved out to the frontiers and settled there for ease of access
		global_colonial_growth = 15
	}
	Z14_berserkers = { #Originally composed of troll-hunters labeled too 'extreme' for the saga guild, the berserkers of Avnkaup are both feared for their rage and renowned for its uses. Known for collecting trophies of their battles, berserks wear the hide of the strongest beast they've slain, such as that of a wyvern or mammoth, or depict their legendary encounters in jet black kraken-ink tattoos scrawled across their body. It's not hard to find these berserkers in the field of combat, just the way they like it. Look to the highest pile of corpses, you're sure to spot one atop it.
		infantry_shock = 0.15
	}
	Z14_love_and_holmgangs = { #For better or worse Avnkaup's society runs on limited central authority, with much of law-enforcement falling on the burden of the individuals. While many of these situations are resolved through gift-giving and mead, some are far more grave. Holmgangs, or duels to the death, have become popular for clearing out corruption and grudges among the villages
		yearly_corruption = -0.1
	}
	Z14_ford_skalds = { #you have not heard a skald sing, until you've heard one's magnificent voice echo through the Nyrford. Here the mountains carry the voice across the lakes and grass, preaching the grand stories of the skaldyrrhic
		global_missionary_strength = 0.01
	}
}

These are now uses in war and hunting to outmaneuver foes and prey
		movement_speed = 0.15
	}

	}

From here, many other nations would adopt Buykonyr regiments.
		cavalry_shock = 0.25
	}

		free_adm_policy = 1
	}

#Rakkaz
F71_ideas = {
	start = {
		cavalry_cost = -0.2 #We have a long tradition of taming the dire-hyenas of the highlands, and our gnolls are trained to ride them from birth.
		harsh_treatment_cost = -0.25 #Rakkaz II is a brutal warlord who has secured her rule through the harshest persecution of dissent.
	}
	bonus = {
		state_maintenance_modifier = -0.25 #Under the Rule of Warlocks the holdings of our pack are decentralized in a complex and shifting web of governance, each warlock responsible for the upkeep of their own dominion.
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = F71
	}

	free = yes

	F71_slayer_of_slayers = { #Though Rakkaz I Slayer-of-Slayers was a loyal general of Gnollakaz, Rakkaz II Slayer-of-Slayers has turned away from Grizaka, breaking off her pack and leading her hyena-riders south to raid Khetapera. She declares Grizaka s proclamation as emperor of gnollkind to be hollow words, and vows to slay her in order to prove her own greatness.
		leader_land_manuever = 1
		cavalry_shock = 0.1
	}
	F71_eye_of_xhazob = { #In the lands where desert sand meets desert grass stands a collapsed rocky dome, ringed with scorched obsidian, its purpose lost to ages. Perhaps the place was a scene of some great battle, or an ancient gnollish city carved into stone. What is certain is that the place hums with residual demonic energies, and it has been host to warlocks longer than our pack has ruled. These warlocks are self-interested opportunists who contract freely with supernatural beings of all kinds, seeking always to gain influence among the most powerful.
		yearly_patriarch_authority = 0.01
	}
	F71_dreadsands = { #Our lands are pocked with fighting pits, testament to a tradition of gladiatorial combat amongst Fieldstalker Gnolls. In ancient times this custom once drew spectators from far abroad, but nowadays the pits have been corrupted to serve a far darker purpose. Goaded by their warlock advisors, our pack s rulers fill them with all number of dissenters and rivals, each of whom meet slow, miserable deaths. Our lands now menace with a palpable suffering, a dark gift to the night hags of the Shadowswamp whom these warlocks are truly courting with. The hags feed off of extreme suffering, and so tolerate our pack s existence and sometimes even deign to empower a warlock to act as their agent.
		global_unrest = -1
	}
	F71_demoncollar_hyenas = { #It is said that gnolls were first created when hyenas were imbued with the power of demons. Our warlocks can mimic this profane gift upon the savage dire-hyenas of the highlands by calling forth the minor demons of hell and trapping them in their flesh. From this ritual we create a savage beast that dominates the battlefield, seeking to avenge itself upon mortals. Only the boldest of gnolls dare ride these demoncollar hyenas, for they are just as likely to eat their rider as they are their enemies.
		cavalry_power = 0.15
		cav_to_inf_ratio = 0.2
	}
	F71_rule_of_warlocks = { #As Rakkaz s rival in Gnollakaz grew mightier by the day and threatened to eclipse the power of our own pack, the Slayers-of-Slayers found themselves relying more and more on the power and counsel of their warlock advisors, warlocks who in truth owed no loyalty except to whatever dark masters they had sworn their oaths to. This situation reached a head as both warlocks in service to demons and those acting as agents to the night hags co-operated to see the line of Rakkaz undone - with the interests of demons and hags alike aligning more often than not, the warlocks found more common ground with each other than they did with the descendants of Rakkaz. In the end the warlocks seized total control, each consenting to be ruled only by a gnoll selected from among their ranks.
		mages_loyalty_modifier = 0.1
		national_focus_years = -5
	}
	F71_loyalty_in_death = { #Under the Rule of Warlocks, the practice of endocannibalism was abrogated - honoring the dead was seen as secondary to making further use of them, after all. The corpses of dead gnolls were brought to the shadowy bogs and fens of the Shadoswamp and left to mummify in the peat. Midway through the process, a slave was tied to the burial site and left to starve. Their suffering gave rise to necromantic energy which suffused the mummy, and a witherling was born, ready to be bound to a warlock s will through fell magic. Witherlings make ideal soldiers, for as undead they are ignored by our demonic hyenas and are capable of receiving the brunt of any attack without complaint, and as former gnolls they retain a savagery and strength of their own. Ultimately, their greatest asset is a total, unswerving loyalty to the warlock who binds them.
		morale_damage_received = -0.1
	}
	F71_charge_of_the_dark_brigade = { #The rise of Haraagtseda to our east spelled the doom of our pack. Not even our mightiest warlocks could match the zeal of those scrap-worshippers, the boons of night hags and demons alike crumbling in the face of Kvangahga. Even as the warlocks fled our country in fear, however, a bold gnoll warrior seized power and rallied the last of our hyena-riders in a glorious charge against the enemy. Yet it was all for naught, as the gnolls of Haraagtseda levied forth their guns and cannons and decimated our riders before they could even draw blood.
		leader_land_shock = 1
	}
}

#Fahvanosy
S71_ideas = {
	start = {
		naval_morale = 0.2
		merchants = 1
	}
	bonus = {
		global_sailors_modifier = 0.20
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = S71 #Fahvanosy
	}
	free = yes

	S71_unity_of_our_people = { #unity of the Vyzemby in the islands for the first time
		global_unrest = -2
	}
	S71_true_to_its_name = { #fahavanosy means summer isles. It is evocative of the inherent natural beauty of the islands, its diverse landscape, flora and fauna.
		prestige = 1
	}
	S71_the_mihipha_colleges = { #it began with the first Mihipha college in Mihitarab, and soon evolved into a series of Mihipha colleges after unification. These schools help foster a new generation of scholars, educators, and ofc Mihipha. These places teach music, history, philosophy, and many other subjects
		technology_cost = -0.05
	}
	S71_legacy_of_the_lizards = { #the old lizard overlords of the vyzemby showed them the value of a good naval doctrine
		naval_forcelimit_modifier = 0.25
	}
	S71_rise_and_renaissance = { #unity and prosperity makes good catalysts for a booming population and economy. New cities are built
		development_cost = -0.10
		build_cost = -0.10
	}
	S71_a_merchant_fleet = { #fahvanosy joining global trade, using its fleet around the world.
		trade_range_modifier = 0.15
		global_ship_trade_power = 0.2
	}

#Tibokbo
L42_ideas = {
	start = {
		land_attrition = -0.15 #Arising in the rough tropical highlands in the East of the Big Island, the halfling culture of "second breakfast" has shifted to being a practice of foraging throughout the day, and many soldiers already have this skill.
		cavalry_power = 0.15 #Dog-riding and training is a keystone of Tibokbo life and as such it is easy to find skilled riders for our cavalry units
	}
	bonus = {
		global_autonomy = -0.05 #With an isolated capital surrounded by jungles and rainforests, the Tibokboan’s naturally developed administrative strategies to mitigate their capital’s isolation. With new technologies making administration easier, they are already one step ahead.
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = L42 #Tibokbo
	}
	free = yes

	L42_dynastic_balances = { #The Five Great Houses have a history of working collaboratively both for the betterment of the nation in a system of informal checks and balances.
		stability_cost_modifier = -0.15
	}
	L42_the_ozamdi_census = { #The seasonal industry that supports pilgrims making their way to the shrine is difficult to tax, creating a census system will help us better tax not just this cottage industry, but every sector.
		global_tax_modifier = 0.1
	}
	L42_guard_dogs_of_favahnosy = { #Tibokbo is often called the guard dog of Favahnosy. This is due to their history of defending against invading human and lizardfolk tribes which crossed the sea from Sarhal. In fact the confederation formed to fight an invasion of lizardfolk from Karassk.
		land_morale = 0.1
	}
	L42_the_ihaza_itsara = { #The Ihaza Istara is a competitive hunt between the member tribes of the confederation. They are used to settle disputes as they believe Ozamdi will grant victory to the tribe with the strongest claim.
		tolerance_own = 2
	}
	L42_ihazadai_reforms = { #Instead of retiring our strongest and most veteran soldiers that guard the chieftess when they are no longer fit to serve, we can give them extra pensions to train the next generation of warriors.
		drill_decay_modifier = -0.25
	}
	L42_the_wyvern_hunters = { #One of the first true modern adventure stories, it is popular both at home and even as far away as Cannor.
		prestige = 1
		adventurers_loyalty_modifier = 0.1
	}
	L42_elephant_gun = { #elephant gun is a term used metaphorically by tibokboans to refer to challenges that the "tall-folk" bring to the islands, that they must often overcome.
		technology_cost = -0.025
		embracement_cost = -0.1
	}
}

		harsh_treatment_cost = -0.1
	}

		improve_relation_modifier = 0.15
	}
	S61_korebitamipi_settlements = {	#adapt well to building in rougher terrains, small fortified farming and mining communities built in hills
		build_cost = -0.10
	}
	S61_mountain_rigour = {	#strict military to contrast tribal Sitewosi and wild Dakinshi warfare, after losing western holdings become even more strict
		infantry_power = 0.1
	}

		trade_efficiency = 0.05

	S61_life_watching_eagle = {	#tribe made of refugee Dakinshi, specialise in agile and precise defensive tactics and medicine to combat their cobra foes

#Kidsit Yitsi
L67_ideas = {
	start = {
		morale_damage_received = -0.1 #been defending their swamp a long time
		tolerance_own = 2 #very religious society
	}
	bonus = {
		global_manpower_modifier = 0.15 #high population
	}
	trigger = {
		tag = L67 #Kidsit Yiti
	}
	free = yes

	L67_a_holy_swamp = { #Kidsit Yitsi is mostly swamp and its people see it as an example of Amilak's perfect swamp in opposition to the Shadow Swamp. As such they treasure the area and don't really drain or reclaim land from it.
		prestige = 1
	}
	L67_a_confederation_of_kings = { #A somewhat loose confederation of kings under a high king. Born after a particularly brutal Tanizu raid in the early 11th century when some of the smaller chiefs in the borderlands banded together under an elected chief from among their ranks. Some of the weakest internal kings can act as diplomats to other states.
		diplomats = 1
	}
	L67_bulwark_of_the_holy_land = { #They see themselves as a bulwark against the Tanizu and Dakinshi, have managed to fend them off from the holy land time after time.
		shock_damage_received = -0.1
	}
	L67_submerged_shamans = { #Water is Amilak's blessing as it appears to come directly from him (the sky), they have made their home in his water and are holier for it. Therefore, those who immerse themselves in the swamps are the holiest of all. Holy men in Kidsit Yitsi live fully in the swamps and lakes, travelling through them between villages and towns, living off the fish and wild Sorghum found in the waterways of the Kingdom.
		global_missionary_strength = 0.02
	}
	L67_ricebasket_of_the_mengi = { #Rice imported from Rahen thrives in the wetlands of Kidsit Yiti. Thanks to this and the Kingdom's relative stability they have an oversized population for their size.
		global_tax_modifier = 0.15
	}
	L67_ever_greater_union = { #The Kings of Kidist Yitsi see their united front as their greatest strength, the thing that has sustained them against the Tanizu and Trolls, the thing that raises them above the other fractured Mengi. They see this unity as proving them to be the final Sitewosi kingdom, and carry on that philosophy to justify being absorbed into Melakmengi seeing that as the final and perfect Mengi kingdom.
	improve_relation_modifier = 0.2
	}

	L67_kwariketema = { #In a united Melakmengi they start using building techniques akin to those of Venice to make better use of the swamps.
		build_cost = -0.1
	}
}

		technology_cost = -0.05
	}

Vast reforms are made, the Naga stripped of positions of power, and artificers appointed to their place.

		reform_progress_growth = 0.15

	}
	
	bonus = {
		num_accepted_cultures = 2 # the lore idea is that Nenfi Remuj mostly expands south and east with little/no offensives against other Fangualan states. hence need for more accepted cultures
		
	}
	
	trigger = {
		tag = L24
	}
	free = yes

	L24_the_northern_homeland= { # the Nenfi people have not forgotten how the Three Mothers led the Mantimatu people to freedom from the brutal krah. they yearn to return to the north
		shock_damage_received = -0.1 # moved shock damage here to distinguish it from Jagab Faru

	}
	
	L24_cow_custodians={ # the nenfi people have a tradition of exchanging cattle between villages in a form of credit, where the contract involving the cow is tattooed on the cow�s skin. this system of credit let the nenfi people mobilize more wealth than their neighbors and made the later transition from pastoralism to trade easier
		interest=-0.5
	}
	
	L24_radi_su_er= {
		development_cost = -0.05
		build_cost=-0.05
	}
	
	L24_princes_overland_routes= { #nenfi merchants have taken great pains to encourage the use of their own overland trade routes as opposed to the more popular sealanes. 
		caravan_power = 0.20
		placed_merchant_power = 2
		
	}

	L24_shelter_tree= { #the nenfi people are sheltered under the tree of God (reference to flag). the tree references a specific tree that was planted by Dojaw? Iru Iyyagba, which is now a shrine where people pray for rain during drought
		tolerance_own = 2
	}
	
	L24_windlords= { # nenfi have a lot of air planetouched, good for moving quickly across central sarhal.
		movement_speed = 0.15
	}
	
	L24_windspeaker_merchants= { # air planetouched merchants are very convincing.
		global_trade_power = 0.10
	}
}

	}

		reform_progress_growth = 0.15
	}

		tolerance_own = 2
	}
	L49_gardeners_of_fangaula = { #The Kaino are the only ones who know how to cultivate the plants of the Dao Nako, a skill made use of by outsiders and the Negefaaman overlords of the eastern jungle. 		development_cost_in_primary_culture = -0.1

		trade_steering = 0.2
	}

		idea_cost = -0.1
	}

	}

		mercenary_manpower = 0.25
	}

		land_morale = 0.1
	}
	Z90_the_reckoning = { #Country Reckoning = Shire Reckoning; became slang for 'folksy timekeeping', was not until circular stone calendar with Gnomish and Old Halfling was found in Turnwell that scholars realize Reckoning could be matched up to actual dates & years, helping to fill in old history by matching folklore descriptions to the calendar. (also insert joke about some thinking it counted down until the end times)
		prestige_decay = -0.01
	}
}

	}

	L58_a_slave_city_built_by_slaves = { #Fetengoni�s slaves built Yetmesira, and their skeletal remains are often found whenever foundational repairs or demolitions are undercarried. After that initial founding there was a law that every slave being sold in the city had to work for at least two weeks in construction or repair in the city before being sold on.
		build_cost = -0.1
	}
	L58_centre_of_the_eastern_trade = { #Many Yeteferen and Metobesi states chose Yetmesira as a port of choice to trade slaves through, partly due to proximity, partly to avoid supporting coastal kingdoms increasingly seen as the puppets of Raheni merchants.
		trade_efficiency = 0.1
	}
	L58_melekinetihadi = { #The upper class of the city are among the few mengi who can sit about and write all day. This first text was written in the early days of the city and is largely read as a religious allegory for the Mengi's first steps into the Holy Land.
		tolerance_own = 2
	}
	L58_rabble_rouser_routines = { #Yetmesira was the base of operations of Eyes-Skyward�s crusade, they witnessed all of the crusaders� strict military tactics. Their city military is based around the same organisation as the crusaders.

	}
	L58_merchants_visit = { #
		diplomatic_upkeep = 1
	}
	L58_ketemamot = { #Text written in 1789, widely considered to be a thinly veiled abolitionist work critiquing Mengi slavery through the lens of Yetmesira being a city built on a rotten foundation.
		idea_cost = -0.1
	}
	L58_the_cannorian_quarter = { #In the 19th century Cannorian diplomats, merchants, and explorers are ONLY allowed in Yetmesira, they are barred from travelling further into Melakmengi. This diversifies the city significantly.

		shock_damage = 0.1 #They are masters in ambushing due to their knowledge of the jungle. Mention the Brothers' Migration.
	}

		build_cost = -0.05 
		global_prov_trade_power_modifier = 0.05 #They live where Tslakiir, the Kooras brother, found the Paleptaiinky and decided that the migration was finished. It's a floating bridge-city on the Harafroy. Big Kooras population center, though a lesser one than the Leptone city. Tli'yam Kyin means city on the river (new words, tli' meaning on the in Kooras and Kyin meaning city in Kooras).
	}
	G03_half_blooded = {
		legitimacy = 1
		devotion = 1
		republican_tradition = 0.3
		horde_unity = 1 #Large Paleptaiinky descent. However, it is now more nobles and chiefs that claim that they're half-Paleptaiinky rather than them actually being one, similarly to the Anbennarian 'half-elves' that actually only have 1/100 of elf blood.
	}
	G03_the_riftwatchers = {
		institution_spread_from_true_faith = 0.2 #Due to their large Paleptaiinky descent, Kooras is the home of most Riftwatchers as well. Some of them manage to control their ability and to get visions in a consistent manner.
	}
	G03_wonders_of_the_paleptaiinky = {
		advisor_cost = -0.1 #Paleptaiinky proto-artificery. Yunun was a Paleptaiinky who had a vision about the advent of artificery and managed to see how the Precursor Relics would be used by it. Riftwatchers use their visions to reverse-engineer artificer inventions.
	}
	G03_friends_throughout_the_stream = { 
		trade_steering = 0.2 #Haraf'ne upstream and gnomes downstream are good allies and trade partners of Kooras. Trade between the two also passes through Kooras and Tli'yam Kyin. Bustling goblin and kobold communities form from the trade route. However, the artificer states end up taking over the tribe due to them.
	}
	G03_eternally_misunderstood = { 
		tolerance_heathen = 2 #They like the Silent Watchers and think that while they may have been heathens, Dikaal's punishment was way too harsh.
	}
}

#Quitl
U30_ideas = {
	start = {
		leader_land_shock = 1 #Shock focus.
		idea_cost = -0.1 #Has syncretized with DCoC in the past, open to new ideas.
	}
	bonus = {
		global_missionary_strength = 0.02 #Theocracy + being more accepted by the larger world.
	}
	
	trigger = {
		tag = U30 #Quitl
	}
	free = yes

	U30_the_death_masks = {
		morale_damage = 0.1 #Syncretism of Kalun Masks and DCoC (Death Cult of Cheshosh) beliefs. They wear masks like the rest of the Mayte, except they aren�t coloured and made out of the very bones of Silent Watchers, making them fearful enemies. Explains how they still revere the King Mask as the remains of the Limbless God�s skull, participating in the Necali Tournaments, and also have a different vision of the "bones/soul" part of the DCoC. They believe that the Sin of the elves was much more about physical than spiritual imperfection, so they wear the bones of sinners to hide their own Sin, while believing that the souls of the faithful, which are stored in the masks, are what make Cheshosh stronger by joining him in death, essentially resulting in a reverse version of the DCoC beliefs (will have different aspect flavor when the DCoC mechanics are done).
	}
	U30_eastern_shadows = {
		same_religion_advisor_cost = -0.1 #Explains how some Mayte even came to worship the DCoC. The Bone Citadel had Mayte subjects they converted in eastern Haraf until 1267, when something (will have to be defined, would be cool to link to the Shadow Plane) happened that started the "king of the hill" period in the Reaper�s Coast and cut off the subservient Mayte, who became the Quitl.
	}
	U30_spirit_feuds = {
		stability_cost_modifier = -0.15 #Blood feuds are settled through battles to the "death", where the loser has their mask destroyed. Their soul is believed to have joined Cheshosh, and they are exiled from society.
	}
	U30_the_skull_of_cheshosh = {
		war_exhaustion = -0.03 #History between 1444 and the arrival of Cannorians. A Necali Tournament is held in 1445 and is attended by the chiefs of many tribes, including the rulers of Benter and Quitl (and Mayte, but that�s a given for a Necali Tournament). The finale ends up being between the three chiefs and is eventually won by the Quitl chief, who returns to his tribe with the King Mask he believes is the skull of the Limbless God. That is obviously unacceptable for the Kalun Masks Mayte, marking the start of a period of conflicts between the tribes, which is eventually won by the Mayte in 1487 who establish the King Mask being passed down through heritage (they don�t stop the Necali Tournaments). This is basically a canon version of the thunderdome system I am planning.
	}
	U30_sharp_edges = {
		shock_damage = 0.1 #They live on the Rim, which possesses quality iron. After Cannorians arrive they start to make blades and are surprisingly good at it. Also talk about how life on the Rim is different and how they call it their home area "the Rimworld". Double entendre with the sharp edges of their blades and the Rim being the edge of Haraf.
	}
	U30_a_shelter = {
		development_cost_in_primary_culture = -0.1 #They become a safe haven for Mayte fleeing Cannorian oppression, as Benter and Mayte get conquered by Minaria and the CLSTC, and take the head of the local anti-Cannorian front, losing their pariah status in the eyes of the other Mayte.
	}
	U30_his_true_will = {
		tolerance_own = 1
		improve_relation_modifier = 0.1 #Mirroring the two other Mayte tags (monarchy Mayte and republic Benter), Quilt ends up founding a theocracy. They proclaim Cheshosh does not require sacrifices at all, instead demanding ritual deaths such as during spirit feuds to absorb the souls and become stronger. Since they put a stop to ritual sacrifices they start being less badly seen by the larger world, but they are still eventually conquered by Minaria.
	}
}

L55_ideas = { #Naleni Ideas
	start = {
		disengagement_chance = 0.1
		available_province_loot = 0.2
	}
	bonus = {
		diplomats = 1
	}

	trigger = {
		tag = L55
	}
	free = yes	#will be added at load.

	L55_pirates_wit = { #The Harpies of the Naleni pirates were once disorganized flocks, but as they grew stronger, they began to spread out. The silver tongues of their leaders let them cut deals and cross cut courts, stitching together a small pirate empire out of the husk of the old Irkan Eparta before anyone could begin to realize how much they really controlled.
		diplomatic_upkeep = 1
		improve_relation_modifier = 0.1
	}
	L55_eye_for_talent = { #Harpies spend their entire lives hunting, and the Pirates of Naleni are no different. They have a fine eye for quality in what they want, both men and treasure. This lets them quickly decide when they raid coastal towns or rival shipping which men would work best under the decks of the galley as rowing slaves, or above board as the soldiers of their new 'masters'.
		global_sailors_modifier = 0.1
		naval_tradition_from_battle = 0.25
	}
	L55_sirens_song = { # the harpies of Naleni are renowned for their singing, even sparking stories of sirens. They have used their skills to great effect in combat, luring in unsuspecting opponents and lowering their guard.
		fire_damage_received = -0.1
	}
	L55_prosperous_racket = { #The Harpies of Naleni have built a league of trading factors throughout the ringlet sea. They double as both merchants and strong arms, negotiating the 'protection fees' to do business in the local ports, as well as reminding people how cheap the price of their protection is, versus almost guaranteed plundering from eager pirates.
		placed_merchant_power = 5
	}
	L55_ravelian_investments = { # Naleni converted to Ravelianism following increasing Busilari presence in the Ringlet in an attempt to strengthen relations. This led to Naleni becoming the center of operations for the church in east Sarhal, resulting in increased education and artificery development.
		technology_cost = -0.05
	}
	L55_aerial_logistics = { # The Naleni pirates have overtime grown to utilize their strengths as harpies to conduct large raids over longer distances than would otherwise be possible
		coast_raid_range = 1 #honestly not sure if this modifier is allowed, the standard raid range is 3 sea tiles.
	}
	L55_mountain_monuments = { # Naleni has carried forth a tradition from the former kingdom of irkan eparta they used to showcase their authority of carving leaders into the sides of the Emot Nepas Sedar. perhaps to show superiority over the former human kingdoms, the harpies of Naleni have constructed their statues far higher than the human carvings. the factional nature of Naleni's political system demands many more statues be carved into the mountain side than their predecessor, resulting in a wealth of masonry and construction knowledge.
		build_cost = -0.1
	}
}

		production_efficiency = 0.10
		burghers_loyalty_modifier = 0.05
	}
	S81_the_naga = { #The Naga have always been an important part of our society having a divine role in our religion. 		missionaries = 1
		global_unrest = -2
	}

		center_of_trade_upgrade_cost = -0.15
	}

		governing_capacity_modifier = 0.15
	}
	S81_many_mutations = { #Lizardfolk have many mutations. Many of them can be really useful on the battlefield.
		fire_damage_received = -0.15
	}
	S81_enemies_within = { #Since the time our efforts to unite lizardfolk started we had not only had to face enemies in battlefields but a new enemy emerged. An enemy of our, the Hags manipulated our society since immemorial. The Hags use those who are foolish enough to bargain with them to further their own agenda- The Hags absolutely oppose a unified Lizardfolk state since it is a great threat for their influence in the rion and thus will do anything to stop us. We need to fight back, arrest those who bargain with them and guard our state from this terrible enemy.
		global_spy_defence = 0.20
		yearly_corruption = -0.1
	}
}
